author: {'steamid': '76561198051084556', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1508688081}
review:
A charming adventure full of humor and niceness! The smooth gameplay without stalemates decorated with an easy-going jazz soundtrack make a combination that feels really cozy and keeps you in a good mood for the entire journey.

I certainly recommend getting the entire trilogy, as with the bundle you will get a small discount and get a little over 10-12 hours of gameplay altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992123547', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1535307118}
review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for The Journey Down: Chapter 2 by SkyGoblin.

The Journey Down Chapter 2 is a point and click adventure game that continues the story of Bwana, Kito and Lina after their airplane crashes into the mist. The game begins with our heroes being rescued by a small eel fishing vessel that’s been lost at sea. The majority of the game takes place in the city of Port Artue which is only mentioned in Chapter 1.

Port Artue is a place full of corruption. Where the rich spend all their time at Club Temba and the poor (Misters) are left doing the work. Upon arrival in Port Artue they’re confronted by the police chief, Barlow. Bwana and Kito are arrested and Lina and her book are taken elsewhere.

In this chapter, the game engine has seen an upgrade and it renders Port Artue in beautiful fashion. The city is beautifully detailed and it still utilizes it’s hand drawn 2D/3D mixture to winning effect. The game also features a section with rain effects and the puddles of water shining on the ground are quite impressive. The lighting effects have also seen an upgrade and they really add to the atmosphere in many areas. The cinema’s lights are the most impressive I felt.

Much like the first game, this game features a superb soundtrack. This time it uses a more jazz oriented theme and it sounds amazing. It fits the city of Port Artue perfectly and it really adds to the atmosphere. There were quite a few really catchy songs in this game, including the main menu theme once it got going.

This chapter is also an hour longer than chapter 1 as well. I clocked in at 4.3 hours to completion. I completed Chapter 1 in 3.3 hours by comparison. The chapter features a large variety of puzzles and they’re always fun to solve.

Overall, The Journey Down Chapter 2 was a superb continuation to Bwana’s journey and I can’t recommend it highly enough. The game features a great story, an excellent soundtrack, gorgeous artwork, and a great cast of interesting characters. It’s a great game all around and it makes me excited to see how Bwana’s story will end in the final chapter.

If you'd like to see my final score for the game, be sure to visit us here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/adventure/the-journey-down-chapter-2-review

author: {'steamid': '76561197969262668', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1458399668}
review:
The adventure continues! Chapter 2 really improves over the first game with bigger action, more locations, fun puzzles and a longer play time. A great sequel with even more polish and shine than the first game. The story get's even more interesting as we meet fun new characters and explore larger new locations.

A great sequel to a fun game. If you enjoyed the first game you will love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193681362', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1507822981}
review: Una buena aventura gráfica, los puzzles no son complicados lo que evita que el jugador se bloquee durante mucho tiempo y consigue una experiencia fluida que te hace meterte facilmente en la história, además durante toda la aventura nos acompañará una excelente banda sonora. La única pega es que el juego solo está en ingles y alemán de modo que si no sabes al menos uno de estos idiomas y no tienes intención de estar utilizando un traductor continuamente, probablemente este no sea un juego para ti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063459813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1507741246}
review: The game takes a much more serious tone than the first one, about twice as long. it improves on the very few shortcomings the first game have, the story become more and more interesting. Some puzzles are a little too simple, but asides from that they've done a great job, many new characters, beautiful locations, Going to play the third chapter now, hope they made it as well as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966111497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1507243467}
review: Chapter two is even better than Chapter one. The game feels more polished, higher quality, and the story is great too. I like the noir themed city in the mist, everything wet from constant raining and digny from the grime of a corrupt city. A lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982504799', 'num_games_owned': 4250, 'num_reviews': 2870, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1507141966}
review:
Путешествие Вниз: Вторая Глава - вторая глава замечательной квестовой трилогии в афро-карибском стиле. Обзор на первую главу здесь - [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Drogobar/recommended/220090/] Путешествие Вниз: Первая Глава [/url]

[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]
В этой части нас ждет продолжение приключений, наших героев, после их не очень удачного побега от мафии. Из-за крушения аэроплана, наши герои оказались недалеко от города Порт Арту, находящегося в полной тьме, на самом краю мира (The Edge), недалеко от бесконечного моря тумана, который по слухам уходит глубоко в Подземный Мир (Underworld). И нашим героям снова придется убегать от мафии, связанной с корпорацией Армандо, а также предстоит разобраться с запутанным клубком из коррупции и конспирации затрагивающей местную элиту. Сюжет чуть длительнее чем в первой главе, при этом все так же интересен. Сохранен фирменной юмор, история в игре вполне может неплохо поднять настроение. В этой части сюжет пропитан атмосферой нуара с примесью карибской стилистики.

[h1]Геймплей.[/h1]
Геймплей в игре навевает воспоминания о старых LucasArts`овских квестов, вроде Grim Fandango и Monkey Island. Головоломок в этой части не много, и большая часть из них на внимательность. Игровой процесс довольно интересный. Игра проходится полностью часа за 3-4 максимум.

[h1]Графика и звуки.[/h1]
Основная особенность осталась - лица персонажей смоделированы с карибских резных масок, город в этот раз прорисован в стиле нуара 30-х годов, но с примесью афрокарибского колорита. Кат-сцен стало больше, и они красивее. Как и в первой главе есть хорошая английская озвучка со своеобразным карибским диалектом свойственным раста, и кроме того хорошая озвучка местной мафии. Музыка в игре все так же прекрасна, в этой части больший упор сделан на хороший джаз.

[h1]Как итог.[/h1]
Как и первая глава, это один из лучших квестов последнего времени. "Старичкам" помнящим олдскульные квесты, и остальным геймерам любящим качественные игры, просто обязателен к приобретению и прохождению!
10 туманов из 10
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126011506

[i]P.s: если этот обзор был для Вас полезен ставьте лайк, а также добавляйтесь в друзья и подписывайтесь на меня как куратора - [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] Обзоры онлайн [/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198280371208', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1506642494}
review:
[b]You’re far away from home, aren’t ya?[/b]

With only the tease of an adventure after leaving Kingsport Bay, we continue a little bit after Chapter One ended. We left Brawna, Kito, and Lina just as they flew away from Kingsport Bay, but with forgetting gas they were left to drift around in the water. Till a boat happened to catch them in their net. Without a lighthouse to guide and a thick fog surrounding them, arriving at land may be difficult to do. At this time, you can also go to Kito for a story recap.

Eventually, you will get back on land after getting a few objects to help in navigating through dense fog. We can’t have a part of the story based on being on a boat the whole time after all. After docking, we find out that the mysterious place plagued with thick fog is Port Artue. Port Artue is not like Kingsport Bay, corruption runs rampant throughout the higher ups. With St. Armando Power Company possibly being the main link to why corruption has taken Port Artue, leaving those doing the work to keep the town running wallowing in a bar. So when a police officer takes the Journal of the Journey Down by force, well, it may not be a surprise to the residents but a surprise to us. 

Instead of grabbing some parts of an airplane, here we deal with the corruption of Port Artue as well as helping the town get back on it’s feet. All leading towards getting the Journal of the Journey Down back and hopefully get to the Underland safely. A lot of questions that were brought up in Chapter One gains some more development in this installment, having played out in this very town.

The puzzles take up the same mantle to solve them. A lot of them are really easy to figure out, with the hints portrayed by dialogue or by other objects needing items that will lead to the puzzle being solved. At times you will get to points where you have to get something, which can stem into a few other puzzles to solve to gain that particular item to advance. However, the last puzzle of the game does hike in difficulty as only half of it is hinted at. 

As we left Kingsport Bay and arrived at Port Artue, we are able to see a whole new area meant to be a town rather than a few places meant to service those visiting. In terms of art style, you still get hand drawn backgrounds and modeled characters based on African tribal masks. With being in more of a town, you do get the sense of people living here and the possible scope of it. With a few interesting ways they show traveling as they focus on colors rather than detailed line art. The sense of Port Artue being a port is also shown by the differing face shapes and accents the new characters possess. 

The sound quality has gone up but not quite there. I often found that some characters had a higher volume than Brawna or the other way around. There were instances where you did expect their voices to go lower, whispering to themselves a realization they had, but there were some instances where Brawna’s voice was lower than the background music and became harder to hear him. 

Unsurprisingly, the soundtrack still holds the same quality as the last chapter. Unlike before, two different composers worked to give Port Artue a unique powerful jazz feel. Even if you never found out that there were different composers, it is hard to tell as both blend in together nicely that it may as well of been done by one person.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
+ Soundtrack
+ Visuals
+ Sense of Port Artue being a popular spot to dock/live 
+ Character design
+ Logical puzzles

- Dialogue volume differs between characters and can cause some lines to be lower than the music

The second chapter to The Journey Down is undoubtedly better than the first. While we only got questions and the adventure just underway in the previous installment, we come into this closer to the mystery of why the Underland is so important to keep on the down low. With the questions we were left with, we finally get some development on them as we explore the corrupt Port Artue. While you do get a recap on the story, I do suggest playing the first chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072812047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1486072041}
review: A refreshingly funny and well-written comedy adventure trilogy, with top notch voice acting, surprisingly good and super-stylized cel-shaded graphics and an entertainingly charming(albeit sometimes a bit confusing in its mythology) neo noir-meets-african-folklore-story. The final part might be a bit too easy, puzzle wise, and flew by very quickly, but as a whole, TJD succeds in doing something new and funny in the otherwise rather stale, unfunny and derivate genre of comedy adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088551232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1443903565}
review:
TL;DR: Funny story, great atmosphere, easy riddles, somewhat short.

The downside is that the game is not that long. It took me only a couple of hourse to complete each chapter.

The upside is that the game is a lot fun! Don't expect any really hard riddles, so if you want to get your head spinning that won't be the right game, but if you enjoy a good story in a great atmosphere supported by great artwork, music and voice acting, with many good occasions for laughing than this is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056837040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1506769305}
review:
The Journey Down: Chapter Two is a great sequel to Chapter One. It is as challenging as the latter, it is slightly longer (you can beat it in about three hours), music is still great (so sad that the composer passed away...), voice acting is better than before, and the story takes you to a couple of great new settings. Moreover, now it's the perfect time to pick it up, as Chapter Three just came out (September 2017)!!! 

If you like point and click adventures, by all means play The Journey Down!

author: {'steamid': '76561198133019486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1493706635}
review: Loved this chapter we went from rastafarian shenanigans to a comedic Noir mystery/prison break, it was a wonderful change of pace without feeling like a different game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276492587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1506100340}
review: So good. I love the new ways of interacting with the game + the animation as always! This game is so enjoyable and feel good, and also very good at subtly placing certain things (ahem, the tape) in. So much love for the game studio, can't wait to play the last chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008765066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1689024989}
review:
At least as good as the first part, which was short, but amazing already.
The setting is amazing, the dialogue is great, and the puzzles are all solvable without having to combine everything until something works. My favorite point and click adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063725672', 'num_games_owned': 10106, 'num_reviews': 458, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1438411097}
review:
Во второй главе Journey Down - авторы наконец-то развернулись на полную мощь и смогли реализовать и продемонстрировать весь свой потенциал, в создании хорошей приключенческой игры. Шикарнейшая и стильная графика, атмосфера нуара и Америки 30х годов (и Monkey Island под самый конец) интересный сюжет, колоритные персонажи, органично подобранная музыка, хорошая работа актеров озвучки, логичные и понятные загадки и увеличенная продолжительность игры в 2-3 раза по сравнению с первой главой.

Недостаток: выход продолжений с периодом в 1-3 года. 

Личная оценка: 7.5/10
[spoiler]А, еще можно на меня подписаться в качестве steam куратора :3
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857971-FanSH-Games/ [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962584064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1504300268}
review:
[h1]Mighty mudyuggler!...Lady![/h1]

The second chapter of TJD was an improvement in nearly every way over the first. There are more set pieces, with even better subtle animation highlights, more cutscenes and the cast has grown. The on point writing with super cheesy jokes remains top notch and this time around the puzzles involve a lot less backtracking. The price is still a slight bit of contention, about 3 hours of content for $11. SkyGoblin was smart however and both Chapters 1&2 can be had for $15 which seems a lot more reasonable a price for what you get in both games combined. I think that if they continue to be smart they will bundle the upcoming third chapter with the first two for an even $20 and it will be a perfect package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1503254822}
review:
Good game. Plays just like Chapter1, and like the Chapter1, it is witty, full of interesting locations and characters, and some intriguing puzzles. Excellent graphics and voice acting and a good story carries this game.

The mystery and adventure unravels even further after barely escaping in Chapter 1 with some familiar and new enemies to deal with leading up to another narrow escape and a an excellent finish  leading up to chapter 3 coming out in Sept. 2017. Looks like it is heading to fun and exciting finish (?) as some questions may finally get answered. Can't wait. Both games only took about 3 hours each to beat, so kind of short, but fun. Reminds me of The Sam & Max series.

Good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143524919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1502731264}
review: La historia -solo esbozada en el primer capítulo- se revela como una siniestra trama de corrupción y abusos en una ciudad rodeada de una perpetua niebla, donde los protagonistas deberán encontrar la forma de ayudar a la ciudad y revelar el misterio que les ha llevado hasta allí. Entretenido y con una estupenda banda sonora, es un juego con un guión trabajado, entretenido y fácil de jugar, incluso para jugadores no experimentados. Promete dar buenos ratos en su próxima entrega fechada para septiembre de 2017.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040315187', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1502658272}
review:
I didn't even know that i have the game in my library, played both chapters and finished it in one day (the games are not that long) It was a great fun. For the price the games have, you get a lots of great characters, nice puzzles, interesting art style, nice voice acting and story that got me interested, can't wait for the third chapter to come out.

Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023332554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1502222190}
review:
Kaufen Kaufen Kaufen.

TJD-C2 ist ein wunderschön und liebevoll gestaltetes Point&Click - Adventure, mit viel Witz, tollen Charakteren, guten Rätseln. Die Musikuntermalung und der Charme der Kulisse sind einfach schön. Tolles, unterhaltsames Spiel.


Ich bin schon ganz gespannt auf den letzten Teil.

Edit: Der letzt Teil ist frisch raus und hat das ganze wirklich hervorragend abgerundet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283593691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1499006032}
review: Very enjoyable. The graphics and (outstanding) soundtrack are on par with the first one. I thought the puzzles were less intuitive than the first one and had to look up some walkthroughs. It's still a great game and I would definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261727141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1497107000}
review:
Doveroso giocare al seguito se anche il primo capitolo è stato giocato.
Non troppo lungo, ma musiche fantastiche e ambientenzioni carine, i personaggi (le maschere) ricordano ion un certo senso Grim Fandango.
Il gioco è semplice e corto, dialoghi (in inglese) ben fatti  (a volte non semplici per chi non sa bene l'inglese).

author: {'steamid': '76561197990029186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1496956722}
review: I had more trouble finding solutions in the first episode than in this second episode. It made it more enjoyable for me as I wasn't running around the place for 15 minutes in a row trying to get any further. I find the story intriguing and am glad that I bought this series so late because the third chapter will release in august of this year. Can't wait!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033604781', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1496782390}
review: Az első rész cuki volt, de nem győzött meg kimondottan. Most a második után alig várom a harmadikat! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198349799908', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1496538473}
review:
7/10
Maior e mais difícil que o primeiro capítulo. Aqui a história vai melhorando, você vai entendendo onde querem chegar. Você não precisa ter o save do primeiro capítulo, aparentemente tudo começa do zero em cada capítulo, são como jogos novos em teoria. É legal como parece ser baseado em algum tipo de mitologia africana, misturando tudo com steampunk.
Recomendo se estiver em promoção, pois são duas horas de gameplay basicamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728266', 'num_games_owned': 2051, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1631263018}
review:
This chapter retains the same high quality of chapter 1.
Logical puzzles, unique and amazing setting, interesting story, great VO, beautiful music, and art. I highly recommend it for any point and click adventure fan.

Only one very minor complaint is that the dialogue can be a bit too much at some points. I would just have liked it to be more concise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040234830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1565986120}
review: I had a lot of fun playing this game, although I finished it in 90 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140585661', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1495955452}
review: Too keen for chapter 3. Really didn't think I'd be so into this story but it's managed to capture me. The art style is unique and it really feels like so much more than "just a pont and click". I do recommend this, the characters are absolute gems!

author: {'steamid': '76561198179720659', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1495918387}
review:
The Journey Down ist ein gelungender 2ter Teil der Reihe, der zwar nichts neu erfindet, das aber auch gar nicht muss. Das Spiel an sich hat sich kein bischen verändert. Es hat einen einzigartigen Look, viel Charm und tolle Charaktere sowie ein gute Story. Diese wird direkt nach Teil 1 angeknüpft und ist spannend und unterhaltsam bis zum Schluss. Das Gameplay ist wie eh und je und ausgefallener zugleich, wie es eben für Point and Klick typisch ist. Die Szenerie ist zudem noch besser als im Vorgänger, da man noch mehr entdecken kann und es sich einfach nach mehr anfühlt. Mehr ist hierbei ein gutes Stichwort, da das Spiel definitv länger ist als der Vorgänger, dabei aber immernoch in einem guten Rahmen bleibt. Die 2 Euro mehr sind hierbei definitv angebracht. Alleine auch schon wegen dem Soundtrack, der wiedereinmal große Klasse ist und mit dem Rest des Spieles harmoniert. Er fühlte sich noch besser an, noch individueller und einfach passend. 
Insgesamt ist ist die Fortsetzung also ein gelungendes zweites Kapitel, das nur noch mehr Vorfreude auf den nächsten Teil macht, der einfach nur genauso gut sein muss um überzeugen zu können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085511707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1495620976}
review: I've played both episodes, really enjoying the art concept of this game, The puzzles are not that tough, very easy going point and click game and short too. I wish they can get more fund to hasten the development process for each episodes. Can't wait for chapter 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198323287074', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1496114637}
review:
从这款游戏的第一部刚出现开始就在玩，当时是在iPad上玩。被这魔性的人物模型和雷鬼乐作为bgm十分令人放松，但又不缺些许惊悚元素，解密谜题也是随着剧情推移越来越难，到最后不得不看攻略。在数年的等待后终于玩到了第二部，一看还有三个月就出第三部了，兴奋之余又会担心自己脑容量不够用（对没错，我是现在卡关了才来写评测的hhh）。很喜欢游戏的叙述风格和线性故事的讲述，期望这个工作室能把这个ip做的更响亮一些hhh。
最后，学Bawana说一句“Hey，man。”hhh

author: {'steamid': '76561198056263749', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1494441927}
review:
Вторая глава "Путешествия вниз" или Journey Down.Впечатления от игры в сравнении с тем когда посмотрел клевый сериал, но если первая глава мне показалась мне неким "пилотом ", то вторая глава уже полноценная серия.
Авторы пошли по экстенсивному пути развития-это тот же квест с интересным сюжетом, загадками, отличной музыкой и качественной картинкой, но этого стало еще больше.Загадки в меру сложные единственное в чем у меня вызвало затруднение -это с решением задачки с компьютером в приемной у мэра (проблема была в русификаторе, решением является удаление русификации и откат к английской версии).  С нетерпением жду выхода 3 главы, а пока остается только ждать....

author: {'steamid': '76561198199722773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1494376313}
review: Такая же классная, как и первая часть. На прохождение потребовалось в 1,5 раза больше времени, но всё равно [b]мало[/b]! Жду третью.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1493558693}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Deuxième partie de cet excellent point&click. Mon avis reste le même que pour la première partie : les puzzles sont simples, les doublages sont bons et les dialogues présentent une touche d'humour. La musique jazz-reggae est un point positif du jeu, elle est fort agréable.

Compter environ 4h pour finir ce deuxième épisode, en avançant tranquillement. Il est nettement plus long que le premier.

Note: le jeu n'est pas disponible en français.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Non, pas de rejouabilité.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

La digne suite du premier épisode. Recommandé.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontré.

OS: Linux Mint 18.1 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993891572', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1492998226}
review: A decent point-and-click adventure. Puzzle aren't too hard, but at least none of them have ridiculous obtuse solutions. I find the main character obnoxious, but the setting, fantastic art and swinging soundtrack make up for his grating stupidity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274566778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1492589324}
review: A Complete Delight! 10/10 , i cant wait for part 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012507724', 'num_games_owned': 1863, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1492466104}
review:
Chapter Two is pretty well done. The puzzles are done really well (better than Chapter One, imo), relying on logically drawn conclusions, without the item-management-guesswork you see so often in bad adventure games. 

It's a bit short, but if you liked chapter one, this one won't let you down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045137468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1492209319}
review:
First off, this game is much longer than the first chapter which is nice. I love the soundtrack! It really helps brings the game to life. The visuals feel better than the first chapter as well. There's often more detail and vibrant color choices than the first chapter. I also liked that some items are used more than once. It felt less routine and mindless, like I never knew if I'd need to use an item that I had already used but in a different way. An overall solid sequel, definitely enjoyed the game!
I'm cheap, so I don't know if I would pay full price for the game, but it was worth every bit that I spent on it via Indie Humble Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039009090', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1621328023}
review:
[b]The Journey Down: Chapter Two[/b] è il seguito della peculiare avventura africano-caraibica della casa produttrice [b]SkyGoblin[/b]. Ho già [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TommyVercetti_ITA/recommended/220090/]recensito[/url] il primo capitolo; in questa rassegna mi soffermerò più che altro sulle differenze tra i due e sugli elementi inediti, evitando per quanto possibile le cose dette precedentemente.

La storia continua da dove era rimasta: Bwana, Kito e Lina, precipitati in mare, vengono recuperati da un peschereccio e portati in salvo nella città insulare di Port Artue, ma non appena mettono piede sulla terraferma scoprono di essersi fatti un pericoloso nemico. E non è il solo.

Rispetto al capitolo precedente, [b]The Journey Down: Chapter Two[/b] presenta una ben più spiccata atmosfera noir, con tanto di gangster, autorità corrotte e fuorilegge intoccabili. Ho già parlato delle somiglianze con [i]Grim Fandango[/i]; in questa seconda parte sembra effettivamente di essere capitati in una vera e propria [i]Rubacava[/i] parallela. Lo squallido bar e il club da benestanti, gli scaricatori di porto senza un soldo e il rispettato capo della polizia chiaramente invischiato in loschi affari, gli amici da salvare (o che vi salveranno!) e gli sgherri mafiosi senza pietà riescono a creare, attraverso la loro contrapposizione, l'immagine di una città essenzialmente popolata da personaggi di dubbia moralità, che siano ricchi o poveri. Per fortuna non mancano alcune anime buone, e saranno queste le persone a cui si dovrà affidare Bwana.
Anche in questo capitolo è presente una forte carica umoristica che bilancia bene l'atmosfera noir, a tratti troppo seriosa, senza mai sfociare nel ridicolo. Bwana e Kito rimangono un duo spassoso, con Lina spesso costretta a rimproverare le loro spiritosaggini.

La grafica è davvero splendida: le ambientazioni, ancora una volta dipinte a mano, sembrano quasi reali. Gli sviluppatori sono persino riusciti a rendere l'effetto della pioggia in modo davvero convincente. Oltre agli sfondi, ho particolarmente apprezzato il design della nave pirata dei Sisulus, che sembra quasi uscita da un [i]Final Fantasy[/i] e che è stata un'aggiunta inaspettata. Infine, se non consideriamo [spoiler]lo scontro "finale" tra Barlow e i gangster, in cui questi ultimi cadono come birilli attratti da una gravità 10 volte maggiore[/spoiler], i filmati sono ben fatti e ben animati.

Il comparto sonoro è pari se non migliore rispetto a quello del gioco precedente. Le melodie reggae sono quasi completamente scartate a favore di musiche jazz e swing in stile [i]Grim Fandango[/i] che rendono l'atmosfera noir ancora più immersiva, con la partecipazione della band [i]Straight No Chaser[/i]. Ogni tonalità, che sia nelle scene di gioco o nei filmati, mi è sembrata azzeccata e gradevole.

In questo capitolo sono presenti molti personaggi che vanno e vengono, e hanno tutti una qualche particolarità che li fa sembrare ben più di semplici comparse. Detto questo, non c'è nessuno che spicchi per memorabilità, e alcuni mi sono sembrati poco sfruttati, come la "regina" dei pirati Sisulus, per esempio. Mi sarebbe anche piaciuto sapere cosa ne è stato di alcuni personaggi dopo la partenza da Port Artue, ma lo svolgimento della trama lo rendeva proibitivo.

[i](Ricordo ancora una volta che sia sottotitoli che doppiaggio non sono disponibili in italiano)[/i]
Anche qui la [b]SkyGoblin[/b] ha giocato molto sugli accenti delle diverse persone che popolano il mondo di gioco: dal pescatore australiano della S.S. Biko ad Andiswa, con accento africano, ai due loschi scaricatori di porto che ricordano i gangster americani nel parlare, fino a personaggi come Morten, Raynolds e Joe che non riesco a identificare, ma che possiedono ciascuno una parlata particolare. Questi piccoli dettagli, se notati, rendono l'ambientazione davvero vibrante e distinta.
Anche il doppiaggio stesso è apprezzabile: è addirittura migliore rispetto al capitolo precedente. L'unico che un po' stona, a parer mio - e mi dispiace dirlo -, è proprio Bwana, che appare più esagerato e fin troppo entusiasta, ma per fortuna nei limiti accettabili.

La difficoltà è ancora una volta bassa. Tutta l'avventura si può risolvere col puro ragionamento logico senza neanche stare troppo a pensare. L'unico punto critico riguarda forse il terminale, ma se si fa attenzione ai dialoghi si capisce come avanzare. La durata è di circa 6 ore, il doppio del capitolo 1, e anche in questo caso la fine lascia la narrazione alquanto in sospeso.

Non ho incontrato bug particolari. L'unica cosa che mi ha fatto storcere il naso è la presenza di errori di scrittura, e non parlo solo dei due puntini di sospensione al posto di tre (che, a tutto dire, c'erano anche nel primo capitolo). Ciò a cui mi riferisco è il libro di navigazione, che ha delle imprecisioni davvero fastidiose: cose tipo "it's" al posto di "its" come aggettivo possessivo e "you're" al posto di "your" abbassano la qualità del gioco, e non c'è scusa che tenga dal momento che un qualsiasi correttore di bozze madrelingua avrebbe potuto controllare e correggere le linee di testo in meno di una giornata.

Un'ultima critica va ad alcuni elementi del gioco poco sfruttati. Escludendo i pirati Sisulus già menzionati, mi sarebbero piaciuti ulteriori enigmi basati sul libro di navigazione; inoltre l'ultimissima parte sarebbe potuta essere un po' più lunga.

Per concludere, [b]The Journey Down: Chapter Two[/b] è un solido punta-e-clicca dotato di buone ambientazioni, grafica gradevole e personaggi interessanti. La semplicità degli enigmi e la durata non troppo elevata potrebbero lasciare un pizzico di amaro in bocca una volta finito il gioco, ma nel complesso l'avventura di Bwana, Kito e Lina non può che far sorridere. Consigliato ai neofiti, a chi sia alla ricerca di un gioco "light" o a chiunque desideri immergersi in un mondo inusuale e accattivante.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979038003', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1491354193}
review: Fantastic experience for those who appreciate music and cultural art. I don't consider myself an expert in either of those, but it's easy to be taken away by the experience anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066234607', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1491151994}
review:
Man, I never heard of that game until the latest humble bundle, and I'm sad of it.
I wizzed through chapter one, and got hooked to chapter 2.
Loved the jazzy soundtrack, the "noir" atmosphere and the corny jokes ("Romantic action movie", yeah...)
Lucky me, chapter 3 is just a few month away, I won't miss the release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050260665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1491061308}
review:
Had a rather enjoyable playthrough. Puzzles aren't overly convoluted or far-fetched, so you don't get stuck too often. For me, that's a good thing, since I play a point-a-click adventure just as much for the story and artwork as the puzzles. You're just encouraged to pay attention and adopt a detective-like kind of mind, to make progression, which when you do, is satisfying. Consulted a walkthrough just a few times (runes at the end :-( )

Found the first chapter to be too short to really connect to. This one had more meat to it. Story is nothing special, but the dialogues, voice-acting, artwork, atmosphere are all pretty good. Liked the neo-noir setting of Port Artue. Makers defintely put their work into it.

When I saw this game in a Humble Bundle sale, it didn't particularly appeal to me. Once fired up though, I came to enjoy it, so was worth to give it go. May decide to get part 3 to see this one through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096205122', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1521337964}
review: Alright this was another amazing game it's not too long but nowhere near as short as chapter one and was actually quite fun. The puzzles were better this time around and weren't any overly easy puzzles like in the first chapter and there are many memorible charecters in this one Ride Reynolds immediately comes to mind. The overall story is pretty good by itself but there are a few plot points that you'd need to play chapter 1 to get. This game got me so pumped for chapter 3 coming out soon and I will definately be playing that all in all 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116244906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1456076849}
review: atmosferi ve artstyleı çok orijinal, hikayesi inanılmaz sürükleyici. puzzle sevenlere öneriyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074772798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1490579601}
review:
Me llama mucho la atención ante todo la estética. Esta sustitución de rostros por máscaras en los personajes en absoluto explicada que añade más misterio al propio de una aventura gráfica (y ayuda a hacer caracterización).

El ambiente nocturno le hace ganar mucho. Y el meterse de lleno en este mundo rico del que uno no tiene ni idea y del que no se explica apenas nada, ir entendiéndolo poco a poco en base a detalles, pero nunca llegando al fondo de la cuesión. ¿Qué son estos seres enmascarados? ¿Dónde viven? ¿Son deidades de algún tipo? ¿Por qué entonces tienen fisiologías y sociedades indistinguibles de las humanas? ¿Son simplemente humanos con otras pintas?

El diseño de puzzles es elegante: éstos no son frustrantes y tienen localizaciones recurrentes que van cambiando según interactuamos con éstas. Sin embargo, no creo que su integración en la historia sea perfecta, a veces funcionan demasiado hacia el detalle. Aunque esta historia esquiva sea una de las bases del misterio aquí, hay algunos arcos que no terminan de encajar, al menos no más allá de lo atmosférico.

De todas formas, un flujo muy agradable entre juego y cinemáticas, y una sensación de misterio constante. Me han gustado mucho estos dos primeros capítulos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107378056', 'num_games_owned': 1517, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1527198564}
review:
7/10 Better than Chapter1; story progress was understandable

I have a hard time giving any P&C too high of a story: Put the right items together to progress. Still, this Chapter was much more lively than the first and created a sense of progresion.

Almost all progress was understandable except for a couple of items (sail boat & raft).  You may want to consult a Walkthrough in a couple spots.  The end puzzle was not obvious, so spend a bit more time thinking about clues before resigning to a Walkthrough.

7/10 well done

author: {'steamid': '76561198008465703', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1490557262}
review: Great story! short but enjoyable from beginning to end

author: {'steamid': '76561198084576089', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1490133192}
review:
I came home after work, I opened my computer and hit the play button. I didn't leave my spot until credits scene. Thank you for this relaxing evening, smiles and admiration for your lovely concepts.

Chapter two is as good as the first one. There are no big challenges, no impossible combinations in this game, maybe that's why the game ends so quickly, but I'm looking forward to playing Chapter Three. It's a good story!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994500066', 'num_games_owned': 1041, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1490016174}
review:
This sequel is a fantastic game. The voice acting and music capture the environment perfectly.
The story continues the intriguing mystery of Bwana's father disappearance, while giving nothing away, provides an ongoing reveal that draws the player in.
Puzzles are a step-up from the previous game, with some puzzles requiring some fun logical and intuitive reasoning.

Length of the game is finally on-par with other great point-and-clicks, featuring about 3.5 acts of story. (3-4 hours of gameplay)

The only issue I had with this game was some of the volume for the voice-acting for the main character to be inconsistent (sometimes to be very soft for no apparent reason). 

9.5/10 with the engaging music and story, this is a definite must play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025459086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1579041131}
review:
I got this game (along with the first chapter) in a game bundle, and I was expecting nothing when I first lauched it. And what a good surprise it was. This game is one of the bests point&click adventures of the decade. It is nothing of the trending "telltale" style games where all is about "choices" and nothing about enigmas. The journey down is a classic linear drill, featuring puzzles that are neither too simple nor too "alternative logic" kind of. 
The graphics are pretty good, and the music is absolutely delicious. The whole thing will remind you Grim Fandango. The game is also quite funny.
The first part came out seven years ago, the conclusion is coming this summer and you should get totally hyped.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087777696', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1705771780}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962215126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1603575488}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049061232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1489338212}
review:
The second chapter from The Journey Down is a rather coherent and well designed title that brings Bwana, Kito and Lina ahead in the search for the Underland. 

Visually, the game might not be first class triple A title worthy, but it does still offer very likeable sights, and above all, it improves over the first chapter of the series. The overall amount of scenes and puzzles do not increase, and the game remains very linear, but all of this contributes to a laid back and relaxed atmosphere that is emphatized by the soundtrack used, which - once again - is one step above the one used in the first chapter (and truth to be said, that one was good already!). 

The characters are very well thought of, and despite being maybe a bit too close to the classic "good" or "bad" guys, they're very, very, precisely designed in every aspect, from their appeareance, to their voice acting, to the dialogues (the way they behave). More importantly, the 3 characters which appeared in the first chapter retain the same voice actor, and they benefit so much of it! Bwana still feels so funky, and you can't help but feel for him :) , same as for Kito, his friend. Other than Lina, all of the other characters are new but the voice over is very well executed with quite some personality (i've seen several triple A titles using far lower quality voice over job than the one you'll have the chance to listen in this game).

Gameplay wise, it's still more or less the same from the previous chapter except for more depth: you happen to came across a tool not working or someone needing some object(s), and you'll have to end up finding or crafting it. It's very basic, it might require a bit more thinking at times, but not that much either. Everything is well laid out, well within your sight. and even the inventory doesn't ever get too full of items you don't need.

Now, a big, important role is played by the music: i happened, more than once, to literally stop playing only to listen to the beatiful, relaxing, chilling music this game offers! It really is one of the few titles i can think of which has such a fitting and well done soundtrack which is contributing so much to the atmosphere. Well done! 

What else? The game only lasts a few hours, but i dare to say it lasts the right amount of time. Every aspect is well thought of, you might happen to need to backtrack sometimes but it won't be a issue, time-wise (Port Artue is a very small town, it seems).

I don't usually complete a review with a vote, but if i had to i would rate this 8,7 out of 10 at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139007144', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 396, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1489346176}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122413358', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1486826101}
review:
Loved the first part, and enjoyed this one as well. The humorous spirit of the first instalment is still there, and the music is excellent once again.

The issues I had with the first part are still there though, too. I know it's a point-and-click adventure, but I still feel there was too much traveling from one side of the map to the other. I also experienced some audio issues, like skipping, during the cutscenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113653131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1486670148}
review:
This is a very nice chillaxed game not so difficult you get fed up with it and drop it, however I thought for £7.99 for chapter 2 was a bit pricey as it wasn`t very long and was over with quite quickly. 
So we have one more part which is fine I just hope the price doesn`t keep going up as this game is starting to mount up.
Price issues aside it is a very pleasant and funny game and I would recommend it to any point and click gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124566395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1486656817}
review: Great game! Can't wait for chapter 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981004234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1485949877}
review:
Thoroughly enjoyed The Journey Down: Chapter Two. Obviously the gamie is mainly aimed at people who've played Chapter One first. That's not too big a problem because Chapter One is fun and awesome so go play it! There is a very brief re-cap at the start of the game should you want to either skip Chapter One or if it's been a while since you played it.

I played the game on Linux Mint 17.3 and it worked flawlessly so well done on the developers for that. 

I'm proud to say that this is one of the few point and click adventure games I've completed in my life without ANY reference to a walkthrough. I don't think this is because the game is too easy, I think it's because the game is very well designed without any "Put the octupus in the toilet to get the gold belt" puzzles. It does help that the game isn't too sprawling so you're not wandering around aimlessly trying to find what you need/where to go. 

The music in the game is outstanding and really helps create a fantastic atmosphere and the character designs are just great. The designers have crafted a particular style and it really works for them. I've even snapped a few screenshots to use as a desktop background for a while. 

The voice acting and script is top-notch too. I want to continue playing the series because I want to spend more time with these characters and in their world. 

Now I just need to wait for Chapter 3. I'm very much looking forward to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007767593', 'num_games_owned': 1881, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1485820160}
review:
Short but longer than the first chapter. Puzzles are still pretty easy. I still like the art. Voice acting is slightly better on most new characters, but some performances are pretty bad. Music, once again, is fantastic, very good job. Story is better than in the first part, though I must say im still not super excited by it. The world is more interesting in my opinion though, and so are Kito and Bwana.

So, I dont know about paying 11 €/$ for it. On sale, however, its worth buying if you are interested in those sorts of games. I was still disappointed on how the game itself was (easiness), but the interesting world, nice art, and fantastic music gives it charm that makes me want to play the third one, whenever that comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014085497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1485721581}
review:
I have been playing P&C adventure games ever since Broken sword first came out on Ps1 (probably even before that actually!) and can honestly say I really enjoyed playing both chapters of this, I was sceptical at first but got ch 1 for about 50p and had to buy this one to see what happens. 

Great music
Great animation
Good story
Puzzles are what you'd expect from this type of game. 

All in all a very enjoyable game to play. My only problem is that unless it's on a decent sale, it's far to short to warrant paying £8.00 for. It took me about 3 hours or so to finish (the rest of the time it was just running in the background whilst i did other stuff).

If you can get it for under £5 I highly recommend playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070390293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1485373772}
review: The Journey Down oldukça güzel bir hikaye ve anlatıma sahip iyi bir adventure oyunu. Eksiklikleri yok denecek kadar az, insanlarla biraz daha fazla sohbet ve etkileşimde bulunabilsek daha iyi bir yapım olabilirmiş, puzzlelar mantıklı, kafa yorunca bulunabiliyor. Grafikler çok hoş,ortamları beğendim. Çok detaylı tasarlanmamış olsalarda yinede iyi iş çıkarılmış. Bu oyunun en güzel 2 yanını söylemek gerekirse biri oynadığımız karakter " Bwana" ikincisi ise oyunun hikayesi. Chapter 2 nasıl 1'e göre daha gelişmişse 3'ünde 2'nin üstüne bayağı şey koyacağı düşüncesindeyim. Müthiş bir final bölümü bizi bekliyor. Skygoblin'e buradan başarılar dilerim ve bu güzel oyun içinde teşekkürü bir borç bilirim. Daha çok adventure oyununa ihtiyacımız var.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973263257', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1515494515}

author: {'steamid': '76561198349195327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1483102326}
review: Great game just like the prequel, some puzzles were a bit too far fetched however. It's tragic that the composer for this game passed away, rest in peace. The music was absolutely amazing as usual with this series. The graphics felt a bit strange at times since the backgrounds are prerendered in another art style, but the game itself is engaging and the comedy is great. Can't wait for the last chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198186006521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1482136183}
review: Quite nice game. I had fun playing it! It wasn't very hard, though... I think the only hard thing to do was to figure out what to typy in the computer as part of one of the puzzles

author: {'steamid': '76561198019255656', 'num_games_owned': 1673, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1481605095}
review: The Journey Down is a really great adventure game - a classic point and click updated for 2016 with great graphics and music! This indie gem will be entertaining to anyone, but people who grew up playing games like Monkey Island will be in for an extra nostalgic treat, as you can clearly see the influence. They added a rastafarian twist to the classic point and click forumula that really pumped it up for me and made the characters very engaging. All in all I'd buy this game. For $10 it was a steal, and for anything less i'd feel guilty about robbing the devs. So if you see it and like the point and click genre, BUY IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315832518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1705798063}
review: I am absolutely in love with both chapters available for this game. The art is great, the voices are great, (although this chapter they seemed a little different), and the puzzles are as hard as the first chapter. I do prefer the first chapter, but this chapter wasn't a let down. Great atmosphere, a little challenging sometimes to figure out what to do next, but worth the play! Can't wait for chapter 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081159072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1480873638}
review:
It is lengthier than the rather short chapter one, while retaining all the things that made the first outing hilarious & fun! Again a bit steep at 10 euros, but definately a good game. 

My full playthrough + behind the scenes: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLljII1wu51JGDhXx_n7ja2ujlWULzHV9M

author: {'steamid': '76561198025184357', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1511818144}
review:
Point and click adventure game with fun characters, good music, good looking locations, and puzzles that don't drive you too nuts trying to solve them.

The first game had an issue where you might notice an item for a later puzzle, but as you had no need for it at the time, you wouldn't pick it up (which was amusing banter until you needed it) and in some cases it was hidden inside another item, so good luck remembering about it if you didn't play it all in a single session and even if you did. 
This game solves that, which makes it much easier to complete a puzzle cause you probably have what you need rather than knowing what you need and not knowing where to get it.

The music fits the flavor of the areas it plays in, the areas are varied, while still making sense together, and I really enjoyed how the characters played off each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238704866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1479340975}
review: Awesome point and click game! Can't wait for the 3rd in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980906655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1479388935}
review:
Longer thant Chapter One, thank God, again most of the puzzles make perfect sense, which is rare for a point n click. I quite enjoyed myself with this one. Still, 10 euros is a bit pricey for 4 hours of gameplay, however enjoyable those 4 hours were. Get it on a sale, fun game, nice universe, puzzles that make sense; I dont regret buying this game.

RIP Simon D'Souza

author: {'steamid': '76561198002913302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1636324539}
review:
The second part of The Journey Down is a lot better than the first part. Story and puzzles complement each other, it is much less linear and a bit longer (4-5 hours). The puzzles are a bit harder than in the first part, too, though still not that challenging for people who frequently play adventure games. 

I thoroughly enjoyed playing this one and hope that the third part is released soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054767631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1475936740}
review:
I absolutely love this game. The characters are wonderfully built and cosistent and it's a great story.

Once I got the feel for the main character (from the first chapter) there wasn't anything I got particularly stuck on. The only hint I would give new players is to have the subtitles on, as this can help give clues with how you need to proceed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972442783', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1474846357}
review: Wonderfully fun point-and-click adventure.  Very enjoyable, the puzzles were not too hard.  Looking forward to chapter 3.  Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012384720', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1474924179}
review: Отличное продолжение первой части! Квестик легкий и ненапряжный, стильный! Учитывая цену, рекомендую и жду третью часть!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995530666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1475083328}
review: There are many Point n Click Adventures, but this series has a heart and soul. It definetly was one of the more pleasant ones I have played. The Art style is nice and clean, the idea to explore are postive thinking marginalized black person is also intrigueing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001813417', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 850, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1474566932}

author: {'steamid': '76561198213850391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1473443815}
review: REally dug this game... great music to listen too, pretty funny characters and dialogue. Just good entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027942416', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1474688164}
review: Journey Down is a good example of traditional point and click adventure games. Puzzles are of the logical variety, and not too challenging. On top this, chapter 2 is a huge improvement over chapter 1. The graphics are improved and the game has an overall more polished feel to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278957965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1474193972}
review: Both chapters are very nice. Waiting for a third chapter

author: {'steamid': '76561198222892304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1506988653}
review:
I bought both chapters months back and didn't really get a chance to sit down and play until now. The second chapter is considerably longer than the second, however they are both very well down and a lot of fun. The voice acting really makes the game, the characters are so interesting, and you really have to pay attention to the plot because it helps a lot.

The jazzy music certainly helped me keep my cool when in challenging spots. Sometimes overthinking will cause you to miss, what you think after, really obvious things. Though the challengs are all apart of the charm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084253815', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1493878742}
review:
[h1] Intro - About [/h1]
This charming puzzle point and click game will have you playing non-stop to have you find out what happens next with these silly characters always getting themselves in twist. Discover what Bwana's father was writing about in his book and help solve the mystery with Kito and Lina.
	Go around collecting items you need to let you progress throught the level, meet more people to give you objectives and learn about your possibilities. 

[h1] Pros & Cons [/h1]
++ [b] Pros [/b]
+ Charming graphics/models
+ Story rich
+ Enough things to do / keep busy
+ Puzzles are not to hard
+ More environment/adventure than the first game

--[b] Cons [/b]
- Audio is off with the video in cut scenes
- Some times hard to find out what your supposed to be doing

[h1] Personal Opinion [/h1]
This game is addictive! I am stuck on his game and was so excited to play it! This is a nice easy chilled out game where you can sit back and enjoy the game and all of its features and surroundings. You have great character personalities, charming cartoony graphics, adventure, goofy jokes, and a story that will keep you going. Take your time and appreciating the art really gets you into the mind set!

[i] This game is just as good as the first one, and i reccomend the frist one as well! I reccomend playing it before you play this one so you FULLY understand whats going on! :)[/i]

[h1] Final recommendation: [/h1]
I highly recommend this game to the gamers that need to relax and enjoy a good story without any rush. I would rate this game 7.5/10 due to minor defects that kind of break the mind set. Other than those I will continue playing these games if there are going to be any sequels or prequels.

[i] If you found this review helpful and want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group:[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation] Follow here![/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198066212081', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1469059410}
review:
Ca fait plaisir de se retrouver dans le climat rasta/roots de TJD... 
L'ambiance est toujours aussi présente que dans le 1 y'a rien à dire, le gameplay reste fidèle à lui même, la bande son est encore mieux, et les graphismes sont plus beaux avec notamment bien plus de cinématiques.
Par contre, comme dans le 1, si vous n'avez pas un niveau à peu près correct d'anglais, oubliez tout de suite... Et même si on peut rajouter une petite heure par rapport à l'opus précédent, la durée de vie reste un peu courte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960540275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1469049383}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042974331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1692559744}
review:
. Игра все такая же яркая, красочная и отлично нарисована. Главный герой — растафарианец Bwana вместе со своим другом Kito попадают в новую передрягу, по пути самолет терпит крушение и они попадают в сети рыбацкого корабля. Как вы заметили, игра выполнена в схожем стиле с Grim Fantango (не смотря что игра 1998 года) и способна обставить многие адвенчуры. В качестве лиц персонажей использованы африканские маски, а в случае Bwana и Kito за основу были взяты в прямом смысле настоящие маски.

. Управление в игре самое простое - Point'n'Click. Сама игра очень увлекательная и затягивает в игровой процесс! Не могу не заметить, что в игре присутствует замечательное музыкальное сопровождение. А в игре каждая локация проработана! Радует глаза! У персонажей голоса подобраны просто превосходно, а так же учтены все акценты и интонации, уже по голосу можно представить какой человек появляется перед нами!

. Снова о музыке: Написана в лучших традиция Джаза и Регги. Автор музыки Simon D'souza (является очень известным музыкантом саксофонистом в Великобритании), очень опечалил уход этого талантливого человека... [b]Спасибо Симон за прекрасную музыку написанную душой, создающую шикарную атмосферу игры...[/b]

. Если вы играли в первую часть, то продолжения путешествия и новых ситуаций вас порадуют! Разработчики все в том же прекрасном духе и своем творчестве отлично выполнили вторую главу и все же я ожидаю третью!


. [b] Все 100 балов по жанру "квеста". Рекомендую всем фанатам и любителям атмосферных и уникальный квестов, игра стоит вашего внимания![/b] 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=723844750

author: {'steamid': '76561198146653036', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1468488919}
review:
I'll review chapter 1 & 2 together, as if they were one single game since their mechanics are exactly the same and the chapter two continues the story from the point where the first chapter ends. Also their play times are very short individually. Even though i like to explore every detail in such games, it took me about 7.5 hours in total to complete both chapters.

TL;DR: Get it if you like pointing, clicking, humor, a bit noir style, a bit mystery, the good old jazz and Bob Marley. :)

[h1]Review[/h1]

The Journey Down is a very nice point & click style adventure game with humor that i would recommend to anybody who likes the genre. If you decide to buy, get the both chapters together. The game doesn't have tedious parts like some members of this genre does. You don't have to watch your character walk for ages, it skips to the place if you double click.

[u]Story[/u]
The story is not the most amazing one i've seen in a point & click style game but it's decent enough. It has some mystery elements and can make you curious at some points. In short, not amazing but good enough to keep you playing.

[u]Puzzles[/u]
Most of the time the puzzles are pretty easy. You usually know what you need to do when you first see an item ,if not, you can figure out quickly. The game is rather relaxing than pushing you hard to solve a puzzle.

[u]Characters[/u]
The characters are cool and their accents are really fun. Their heads are inspired by african tribal masks. You play as a young guy named Bwana. There are two other main characters named Kito and Lina. I liked all of the characters in the game especially our guy Bwana.

[u]Art and Atmosphere[/u]
The art design is very charming. The game has a nice carribean and also noir atmosphere. The hand drawn places look wonderful. 

[u]Soundtracks[/u]
One of the best things about the game ,besides its art design, is it's soundtracks. It includes some reggae and jazz tunes and the soundtracks become more jazzy in second chapter. The music fits well with the atmosphere of the game.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Charming atmosphere
[*]Likeable characters
[*]Beautiful art design
[*]Awesome soundtracks
[*]Good enough story
[*]Fun accents
[*]Character animations are not tedious
[*]Gives you access to some nice behind the scene content when you finish a chapter
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Short play time
[*]Places are somehow limited, not many different places
[*]Puzzles are too easy sometimes, they don't require much thinking
[*]Sometimes it feels like things are happening faster and easier than it should (or is it just me?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034818783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1468496731}
review: Recuerda mucho a Grim Fandango

author: {'steamid': '76561198121676772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1468205779}
review:
Chapter Two of the Journey Down was very satisfying after completing Chapter One. The plot develops well, the music and artwork is even more incredible, and you get introduced to many new people and places. There were a couple of times where I acquired items or seemed to have a task to obtain an item without clearly knowing the reason for it. This isn't uncommon in PAC games and perhaps it's because I talked to people out of order, but I found this detracted a bit from the story. The other thing I found was that Bwana's voice was consistently quieter than everyone else's, and I had to adjust my volume a bit to avoid other characters sounding like they were shouting - just a sound-mixing issue.

Looking forward to Chapter 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031765203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1467378849}
review:
The Journey Down: Chapter Two continues the story from part one.

In part one we didn't really get much of a story or what was going on - it was basically just to set up the initial plot and give you a feel for the world and characters.

In part two we get a lot more story and a much better idea of what is going on.

Again, there is a lot of charm to the world and environment. The game has a real noir/jazz French feel combined with carribean influences.

The puzzles are fairly simple again - similar to the first game in difficulty. I wouldn't say any of the puzzles are too difficult.

Overall I was very happy with this title and I am looking forward to part three! Great work here. Highly recommended for point and click fans - or if you are new to the genre this is a great series to start with.

The Journey Down: Chapter Two takes about 3-4 hours to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091159333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1465483051}
review:
Love this game. If you've played Grim Fandango, you could say there's some similarity in gameplay and music.
And best of all it's much longer than Chapter One. (too bad not all of the places in Chapter Two can be visited)
Really enjoyed the music, it's rich and vibrant. 
The puzzles are a bit hard because there's not much clues provided during in-game.
But nonetheless, since i love this genre, i don't mind spending time even though sometimes the puzzle doesn't make sense.
Hope that Chapter Three will be coming out soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728166', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1463542013}
review:
[url=store.steampowered.com/app/262850/]The Journey Down: Chapter Two[/url] picks up exactly where the first installment left off, and it expects you to have fully played it as it wastes no time with lengthy re-introductions, save for a quick recap conversation with your trusted friend Kito.

For its intermediate chapter, the series traded its positively laid-back vibe for a resolutely noir ambiance. This is in part due to the nature of Port Artue, the game's main location, set in the confines of a dark mist. Consequently, pitch black darkness and haze envelops most scenes' skylines instead of the warm hues of dusk, city lights and waterfront of the first game.

The visuals look great as a general rule, though some of the art panels are manifestly sketchier. It is never too distracting but it feels lightly inconsistent with the other fully realized backgrounds. Many scenes feel monochromatic, whereas the first game was resolutely more lively. The music is also somewhat less festive but just as effective most of the time.

Regardless of the change in tone, the game hasn't really lost much of its charm. Its characters and situations are truly enjoyable. The first half of the game features less of the cinematic moments and animated transitions. Whereas Chapter One felt more immediate, Chapter Two takes some time to build up into a genuinely fun experience. It picks up tremendous momentum about halfway through, and ultimately reaches the simple greatness of its shorter debut episode.

Bwana remains one of the most original and charismatic characters I've played in point-and-click adventure games. While a lot of his success resides on pure luck, he's delightedly never portrayed as an idiot or incompetent. Puzzles are generally fairly obvious and pleasant to solve, focusing more on the story than on challenging enigmas.

The story unmistakably sets the stage for the third and final chapter but is still satisfyingly conclusive on its own. Chapter Two is nearly twice as long as Chapter One. If you have any interest in this game, and you should, you owe it to yourself to start with the first episode, for which I also wrote a [url=steamcommunity.com/id/ElusiveOne/recommended/220090]short but glowing review[/url].

Chapter Three can't come soon enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056524362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1462749035}
review:
This game has a nice, unique graphical style with likable characters and a good soundtrack.

However there are a few key components of a point-and-click game where the game unfortunately falls short:

1. Storyline:
The story-line is very linear. A P&C game has to be linear to some degree by necessity, and I have no problem with this, but this is taken to the extreme here. Commonly you have some degree of choice in which order you want to accomplish certain tasks, e.g. some tasks that require completions of several puzzles could be done in your order of choice. In this game the path is set and it is pretty clear what is required as the next step at every moment decreasing the illusion of having an influence on the storyline...

Also, it feels like there is a lot of the story that was lost on the way, like the release was somewhat rushed before the game was finished. E.g. there is a map that you find early in the game indicating many places that are not available in the game. The game design with the taxi makes me think there were bigger plans from start...

2. Difficulty/challenge:
I guess this is the most difficult aspect to get right with a P&C game. If puzzles are too hard you get stuck all the time, feel stupid, and the gameplay is not very enjoyable. If too easy, the game feels less meaningful and you do not get the nice feeling of accomplishment. This game was on the "too easy" part of the scale. Puzzles were very easy and combined with the linerar storyline, there was no point in the game where I had to stop and think. On the plus-side, although not very challenging, puzzles were generally logical and did not rely on pixel hunting...

3. Length:
Perhaps as a product of the two points above, the game felt very short. Being decently affordable and presented as an episode of a game rather tha a full game, perhaps this is to be expected. I guess that the unfinished feeling of lost intrigue/parts of the game, emphasize this feeling even more though...

Verdict:
Despite its shortcomings, the game has a certain charm to it and it was generally enjoyable. I will likely pick up part 3 when available. Although there are many other P&C games I would recommend before this one, there are also many that are worse...

author: {'steamid': '76561198021217901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1462827824}
