author: {'steamid': '76561198115158556', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1462021615}
review:
9.1/10 – A Massively Overlooked Point and Click Series!

I loved the first episode; but this one really pumped me up and got me hooked on the series! I enjoyed this so much that I will definitely buy the third episode and likely anything else from this developer moving forward. The game itself is beautiful, a blend of steampunk and detective/noir elements! The overall story, content and atmosphere really take the series to the next level!

This game picks up where Bwana and Kito left off; journeying to the magic underworld in search of their long lost father! Once again, the puzzles, graphics and voice acting are all top notch and exceed my growing expectations. I feel like the price is right at $11; the game really brings together all elements perfectly. It took me just shy of (4) hours to complete. My only complaint is that these games aren't being cranked out fast enough! It's about a year in-between each game which is understandable... but I want more.

Worth the $11; Grab on sale for less than $7 if you can! Story really takes off in this one.

review: Good value for how much I got it for. Chapter 2 was a very big step from chapter 1. I am in love with the story. Hope chapter 3 is as interesting. Very lighthearted puzzle solving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055306597', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1461367804}
review:
I couldn't bring myself to enjoy the second installment. Music is well produced, and the presentation is alright. Graphics are alright, though animation is quite poor (the lower budget coming through).

All of that is forgiveable, but, unfortunately, I never found myself caring much for the story itself. There were not really any attempts at humor either. So all that's left are the puzzle, which you will finish in 2-3 hours, without much challenge. Most puzzles seem to be locked behind an arbitrary event, forcing you to figure out the order of puzzles by trial and error.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044380284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1460993710}
review: Steam's time played counter stands at 3 hours for this game for me, 3 hours something likely, and despite that, I don't mind. I don't mind at all. Chapter Two of The Journey Down series is an experience pretty much any point and click fan should play through. It pulls of a pleasant balance of noir and infectious positivity, optimism, backed with undeniable visual stylishness and a superb soundtrack that couldn't be more fitting than it is. Now, I might not like all the aspects of the graphics - something about the main character just doesn't sit with me for example - and he's not the only one, but, face it, pulling off a genuinely atmospheric blend of jazzy noir with African tribal art and a mild dash of rasta culture, perhaps, is worthy of respect. The chapter functions well on its own - my memories of the first chapter are beyond fuzzy, but the game does well to explain the background and add and expand the, again, quite original and interesting lore. It does get silly, beyond silly at times, but that grates far less than it does in some other games. The cast of characters is more or less interesting, tropes or not too, some of them memorable, with some obvious hat-tipping going on around. The game is, as can be seen from my playing time, short, and I'll add easy. I AM a seasoned p&c player, but I've played through most of it @ 4AM with half my brain working likely, and the rest, including the final puzzle(s) did not pose much of a problem. You won't or at least shouldn't be wandering around aimlessly, you can't make a mistake really, everything is more or less dead obvious if you listen/read and remember what's there. Only one puzzle, with a car, had me wandering around pixelhunting (not needed in the game really) until I used an item that's really not THAT obvious or hinted at. But hey, as the old p&c adage goes... "when stuck, use everything on everything", right? Eh. Another plus is that, despite it being short, it doesn't feel as short as it is. All in all, a sequel superior to the original that left me wanting more. Will definitely get the third chapter once it's out. Good job!

review: Highly recommended to point-and-click adventure fans. The game has a Grim-Fandago feel to it with and a Jaimacan flavor. Thus far, the story, puzzles, and animation are all superb. I can't wait for the third installment. Having purchased the first 2 on sale, I owe to the developers to pay full price. They clearly put a lot of effort into this series. Give it a try while it's on sale, you won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1460752525}
review:
A wonderful sequel. Pretty much everything is great. The story is a bit weird and without the excellent writing it might be hard to follow. But it is easy to understand the story and what you need to do to progress.

The voice acting and music are excellent. Puzzles are on the easy side, but fair and not frustrating. I did have a bit of trouble with the last puzzle, the rune puzzle. I mostly figured it out for myself but needed a bit of a hint. 

Very much looking forward to the third chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985062001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1460623865}
review:
Macht Spaß! Clevere, immer auch lösbare Rätsel, witzige Charaktere, guter Sound und Grafik, sehr gute (englische Sprecher). Bei mir fand im zweiten Teil manchmal der Mauszeiger/Pointer nicht mehr sein Ziel, so dass ich speichern und das Spiel neu starten musste, auch in einigen Dialogen war die Lautstärke der verschiedenen Charaktere nicht immer synchron (einige lauter als andere). Aber insgesamt ein solides Point and Click Adventure für zwischendurch.

Den von einem User beschriebenen Crash beim Umschalten zwischen Fenster- und Vollbildmodus auf dem Mac hatte ich kein einziges Mal.

Der erste Teil war übrigens extrem kurz - das liefern einige als Demo. Der zweite Teil war dann schon deutlich besser und ausführlicher, den hatte ich aber ebenfalls in unter 5 Stunden durch. Freue mich schon auf den dritten (und vermutlich letzten) Teil, der gerade in der Entwicklung ist!! ;-)

Von mir gibt's hierfür eine Empfehlung.

PS: Mir ist aber nicht klar, warum das Bundle aus 1+2 teurer als die einzelnen Teile sein soll...

author: {'steamid': '76561198037170389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1506001867}
review:
O-B-R-A   M-A-E-S-T-R-A 

De las mejores aventuras gráficas que he jugado jamás y posiblemente la mejor, si el capitulo uno me dejó enamorado esté me ha dejado enloquecido es sencillamente impresionante y no solo está a la altura de los clásicos sino que incluso los supera. La atmosfera es realmente envolvedora y hace que te acabes 'encariñando' de los personajes tal como ocurría con su antecesor espiritual: Grim Fandango.

En este capítulo dos han mejorado bastantes cosas como los gráficos, es más rápido desplazarse por el escenario y es mucho más largo (5 horas y puede extenderse a 6 si no eres muy habilidoso con los puzzles). 

Al igual que el anterior está en inglés pero no se necesita un nivel muy alto.

Estoy realmente impaciente por jugar al capítulo tres que saldrá en septiembre de este año (se me va a hacer la espera eterna)... el juego me ha atrapado totalmente y no pararé de recomendaroslo con todas mis fuerzas porque os aseguro que os va a encantar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971291058', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1454294747}
review:
This is a great living room game. The riddles are mostly quite straight forward, the characters are very likeable, and the story is a good driver.

For consistency you should also play Chapter One, which is much shorter and not as professionally produced, but still entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996354180', 'num_games_owned': 947, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1472316405}
review:
I can't say enough positive things about this game. It's even better than Chapter One, which, while solid, felt almost like a demo or introduction to the game world, without revealing too much of its history and lore. This chapter gets into the real meat of the story. As in the first chapter, the art design, music, characters, and puzzles are all excellent. The main character, Bwana, is hilarious, yet doesn't follow the long tradition of point-and-click (and parser-based) adventure games going back to goofballs like Roger Wilco and Larry Laffer of being an inept loser. Instead, he's more of a happy-go-lucky guy who seems to be enjoying himself no matter what he's doing.

One of the really cool things about this game is that your character, in the course of solving puzzles to progress the game, actually does a lot of good and helps quite a few people improve their lots. It makes the game even more satisfying. I did get slightly stuck here and there on puzzles, but never to the point where I needed to look online for hints. Everything was quite intuitive, and I almost always felt inspired with an idea for how to solve problems. There are lots of clever ideas in the puzzles, and a few relatively straightforward but well designed logic puzzles as well. And you do get a ton of backstory and exposition about what the heck is going on. The game ends on a big cliffhanger, and I absolutely cannot wait for the next chapter. At the rate they're going, it should be amazing.

TL;DR if you've ever enjoyed pont-and-clicks, buy this game. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003172561', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1460026397}
review:
Какое-то преступно малое количество людей знает про этот квест. Может кто-то даже помнит как я давно ролик по первой главе делал. Так вот, имейте совесть, поиграйте уже, maximum doosha.
Стиль есть, юмор есть, милейшие африканские акценты есть, тупых головоломок нет. Две вещи к которым можно придраться:
1. Озвучка второстепенных персонажей иногда проседает в качестве, а на основных иногда прорывается печальный шумодав. 
2. Между релизами глав проходит много времени, но на третью бюджет уже есть и третья будет последней, так что не критично.
Зацените штоле, allright mon?

author: {'steamid': '76561198031762613', 'num_games_owned': 9030, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1451233105}
review:
[b]Eine gelungene Fortsetzung zur Geschichte hinter "The Journey Down".[/b]

[h1][b]Die Story:[/b][/h1]

Die Abendteuer von Bwana und Kito gehen weiter!
Auf der Jagd, nach dem gestohlenen Buch "The Journey Down", findet Bwana heraus, dass sein verschollener Adoptivvater Kaunandodo mehr als nur ein Pilot war. Er war auf der Suche nach den Schätzen des "Underlands", einer Welt, die man einerseits als Märchen bezeichnete aber andererseits jegliche Nachforschungen bezüglich dieses Ortes strengstens verboten waren.
Wo ein Schatz ist, gibt es logischerweise auch Piraten oder Diebe, die diesen in die Finger bekommen wollen.
Auf der Suche nach ihrem verschollenem Vater, treffen Bwana und Kito auf eine vielzahl kurioser Gestallten, die ihnen zu einem Großteil nicht gerade freundlich gesinnt sind.

Die verzweigte Story, die einen immer wieder ins Grübeln bringt, reißt einen sofort mit. Jedoch sind einige Abschnitte zu klassisch aus einem Film mit Banden oder der Mafia entnommen. Dennoch gebe ich hier satte 8/10 Punkten.


[h1][b]Das Gameplay:[/b][/h1]

An dieser Stelle kann ich eigentlich nur auf mein Review für das erste Kapitel (The Journey Down: Chapter One) verweisen; dennoch wiederhole ich es hier einfach nochmal, da es in diesem Spiel einige Extrapunkte hier und da gibt:

Es ist ein simples Point&Click Spiel, bei dem es gilt, Rätsel durch Mausklick, mittels für normal Sterbliche unlogischen Aktionen, zu lösen.

Da es hierbei aber nicht nur das einfache Interagieren mit Gegenständen ist, sondern auch teilweise wirkliche Puzzel zu lösen sind, und teilweise auch wirkliche Aktionen vom Spieler selbst gefordert sind wie etwa das Zerschlagen des Dschungeldickichts mit einer Machete oder das Zertrümmern einer Wand mit einer Spitzhacke, vergebe ich hier 7/10 Punkten. Also kann ich hier getrost 7/10 Punkten vergeben.


[h1][b]Meine Bewertung:[/b][/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*]80er Jahre-Feeling
[*]Längere Story als der Vorgänger
[*]Ausgeglichenere Rätsel
[*]Passendere Hintergrundmusik
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*]Wenig Abwechslung bei Interaktionsanimationen
[*]Wieder ein Cliff-Hanger wie beim Vorgänger
[/list]


[h1][b]Mein Fazit:[/b][/h1]

Da sich meines Erachtens nach alles zumindest ein bisschen gebessert hat, was beim Vorgänger fehlte oder schlecht gemacht wurde, aber ansonsten das Spiel an sich nicht verändert wurde, orientier ich mich einfach an der Bewertung die ich für den ersten Teil der Reihe abgegeben habe:

Dem Vorgänger gab ich 6/10 Punkten, aufgrund einiger Mängel, die aber in diesem Spiel nicht mehr vorhanden sind.
Somit würde ich großzügiger Weise 8/10 Punkten vergeben, was auch nahezu deckungsgleich mit dem Verrechnen der Rohpunkte wäre.


[i][b]Dieses Review wurde als Wertung innerhalb des eigenen Genres verfasst.[/b]

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm auf [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-]German_Gamer_Community[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197986589495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1411313236}
review: Very enyoable with a feeling of Grim Fandango. Still The journey Down: Chapter Two has it's own style and uniqe story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1435595883}
review:
After escaping gangsters in Chapter One, Bwana, Kito and Lina arrived at their destination of Port Artue. Still searching for the Underland, Bwana and Kito are arrested and thrown in jail while Lina is taken as hostage by the police. What will happen to our heroes?

I enjoyed that point-&-click adventure because of the atmosphere. There is clearly influenced by Afro-Caribbean (as the characters are inspired from African masks but the way they're talking and the music is more from the Caribbean). Bwana still retains his cool personnality while being perhaps in another world. And that, dear gamers, that what I ask also from an adventure game: characters with a grey personnality as they're reflecting what we are: imperfect. Bwana isn't stupid. Some of his remarks show someone aware of his surrounding, feeling down because of his father's disappearance. Kito, his "street" brother, is a genius when it comes to engineering, despite his cool attitude. Lyna, well-mannered, stays polite and provides information on what may happen in the background. She's never pressuring the boys, apart when they foiled her plan. Besides, the fact that the ambiance is also leading to a comedy game is also doing that.

Here, the graphics are more "modern" as Port Artue seems to be more a city. The ambiance is now more jazzy, which isn't bad in itself. It's changing from the first game.

Anyway, the whole game seemed to be set in a film noir though here, the police is clearly corrupt.

The game is longer than the first chapter, which is a good point, though you need imagination to find sometimes a solution. Besides, the ending is quite different: after the foggy sad town, you're on a tropical island with sun everywhere.

Anyway, I'm very impatient for Chapter Three and to discover what happened really, as some twists were present in this game (not about Lina, though, despite what Bwana may think).

Don't hesitate anyway: The Journey Down is really a good series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993589814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1449158280}
review:
The Journey Down: Chapter Two is a memorable point-and-click adventure worthy of being being compared with the Monkey Island series and Grim Fandango, which obviously served as its inspirations. Every fan of adventure games knows that their overall quality has gone down quite a bit in the recent years, and it is very hard for the modern iterations to live up to the standards set by the old guard. However, while I was playing this game, I felt as if I was transported back to the 1990s. The production quality is superb, the soundtrack kicks ass and the noir atmosphere is amazing and creates the atmosphere of a 1950s noir film.

Most of the puzzles are sensible and not that difficult, although some of them can be solved out of order (ahead of time), which makes you wonder "What am I supposed to do with this item?", until you find a use for it later. Only the last one gave me a real headache and made me resort to a walkthrough, but given the overall quality of the game, all is forgiven.

TLDR: if you liked Monkey Island and Grim Fandango, do yourself a favor and get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094805548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1419088770}
review:
Short and sweet. like the first. a little too short, but sweet enough to make up for it.
Even for a single chapter - it's a little short.

The game is well made, decent (if not great) voice acting, good story, very original world with a unique and interesting visual style that compliments the story and the characters. 

The story evolves in an interesting direction. overall - good game. can't wait for chapter 3

author: {'steamid': '76561198067263809', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1447883241}
review:
As far as I'm concerned this is NO downside to this game. It's completely satisfying, as is.

* Still plays like an spiritual sequel to [i]Grim Fandango[/i] but with Afro-Caribbean and Pan-African design sensibilites rather than indigenous Mexican aesthetics. Absolutely gorgeous level design and character modelling. 

* The puzzles are slightly more challenging than in Chapter One, with a healthy mix of lateral thinking, minigames, and inventory management. 

* Even better storytelling than Chapter One. If this started out with heavy Indiana Jones vibes, then Chapter Two brings it firmly into D!ck Tracy territory, with dirty cops, intimidating mobsters, corrupt powers-that-be, and a bleaker urban noir vibe.

* Builds on the setting established in Chapter One. Fascinating, in-depth world-building, from the mistfarer trade and piracy on the "high soup" to the looming threat of the influential San Armando Power Company.

* Quality soundtrack -- a lively mix of laid-back Caribbean island grooves and freewheeling jazz.

Needless to say, I wholeheartedly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104334578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1533455594}
review:
In short: This game is absolutely awesome. Truely, one of the, if not the best adventure series I ever played, in one line with masterpieces such as Monkey Islands, Grim Fandango, Simon and Sam&Max ... maybe even better than those.

Ultra funny, great soundtrack, awesome voices, marvelous graphics and last but also very important a thrilling story. I'm absolutely stunned.
The puzzels are very logical, no stupid bullshit combinations, maybe sometimes even a little bit to obvious, could be a little trickier sometimes. And just as it ought to be there are plenty of hidden hints in the dialogs. Perfect!
The story is the perfect combination of thrilling adventures with enough hilarious dialogs to ease up the excitement so it never gets too tense. Bwana, is cool with any situation.
The dialogs are brilliant and the voices of the characters are a true pleasure to listen to, especially of course Bwana and Kito.
The whole adventure is supported by an awesome chilling and thrilling soundtrack.
All together a true masterpiece. My new favourite adventure.

The first part was a little bit short but honestly, time flys when playing such a great adventure. The second part is of perfect length to my taste.

I'd really wish this story never ends I'm craving for the next part of the adventure...

author: {'steamid': '76561198156077673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1445871691}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984737819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1444525708}
review:
Wow... the first game was rather MEH-ish minus the characters which I thought were refreshing but the sequel took the characters which I already really liked into more of a crime-noiresque place. It is VASTLY superior to the first game in every way and there were NO puzzles I wasnt able to muddle through and solve via logic... unlike the the one specific ingredient thing from the first game. I would HIGHLY recommend this rather chill rastanoirian adventure... PLay the first game to get ready for this EXCEPTIONAL sequel though. 

The music is also wonderful here btw. -10-10

*Please watch the behind the scenes to discover more about the talented musical artist that passed away- that made me very sad-

author: {'steamid': '76561198071828346', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1444345390}
review: Chapter two continues the story of Bwana and Kito in a new and fascinating setting and sets the story for the third chapter. This episode is longer and larger than the previous one: awesome music and great voice acting and the level of detail is again surprising for an indie production. Puzzles still remain relatively easy, with the notable exception of the last one that I definitely loved. In few words, bigger and better,

author: {'steamid': '76561198133735923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1443847380}
review: Really good game, creative characters and ideas. Just a shame it was very short

author: {'steamid': '76561198248569588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1443939945}
review: Chapter 2 of [i]The Journey Down[/i] is just as much fun and as well made as Chapter 1.  As before, the puzzles make you think but they're always solvable; the interface is easy to understand; and you can never screw up so badly that you can't complete the game, No reflexes necessary in this point-and-click, perfect for a klutz like me.  The music and graphics are fun and refreshing.  I've only encountered technical difficulties in one spot and they were minor, easily fixed by moving out of the scene and back in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089643289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1442501257}
review: great music, good story, incredible characters 10/10 looking forward for the 3rd

author: {'steamid': '76561197976138338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1424102159}
review:
The Journey Down ist für mich wahrscheinlich seit den Zeiten von Monkey Island das beste Adventure! Die Geschichte ist super aufgebaut, die Charaktere sind interessant gezeichnet und die 3D-Modelle haben einfach Stil! Zudem ist das Spiel noch super witzig! 
Ich kann kaum noch länger auf Chapter 3 warten! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198203335804', 'num_games_owned': 2498, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1425986505}
review:
9.2/10
解谜益智小游戏，值得一玩
保持了第一章的所有优点，没有太多创新。但游戏本身素质还不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006049410', 'num_games_owned': 3505, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1452867534}
review:
Während das (auch schon gelungene) erste Kapitel noch etwas darunter litt, dass es als Prolog diente und die Story nicht recht in Fahrt kam, ist Kapitel 2 nun einfach in jeder Hinsicht besser geworden. Zusätzlich zu dem vom ersten Kapitel gewohnten Charme und den fairen Rätseln liefert Teil 2 nun bedeutend mehr Abwechslung in seinen Lokalitäten und eine gut erzählte und immer unterhaltsame Story. So sollten Adventures sein, sehr schön!
Wenn Kapitel 3 das hier herrschende Niveau hält, wird "The Journey Down" wohl eines der besten Adventures der letzten Jahre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047384465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1440464989}
review: Wonderful sequel to The Journey Down: Chapter one. If you enjoyed the first part you'll enjoy this game just as much (if not more). If you're new to this saga I recommend playing the first part to get aqquainted with the story and characters first, although playing this first won't take away too much of the experience as they do give a recap.  Great characters, beautiful music and some really stunning visuals. There's some great voicework here again which really adds something to the game. The puzzles were enjoyable, although a tad easy at times. I did come across a few bugs here and there (but nothing that a restart wouldn't fix)  An overall enjoyable game, looking forward to playing Chapter 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029605995', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1439895155}
review: Parádny humor, príbeh, dabing, hudba,...

author: {'steamid': '76561198096659857', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1438944810}
review:
The Journey Down: Chapter Two - вторая глава прекрасной доброй приятной юморной адвенчуры с отличной музыкой, которая всегда к месту. Все, что было хорошо и замечательно в первой главе, есть и во второй. Но теперь это настоящее приключение, а не вступление к нему, герои пройдут через разные передряги и географические места. Продолжительность второй главы выше, чем у первой - мое прохождение заняло чуть больше пяти часов (против трех часов на первую главу). Минус тот же - 3d модели персонажей по прежнему иногда слишком выделяются среди нарисованного фона. 

The Journey Down: Chapter Two - прекрасная адвенчура, оставившая у меня, как и Chapter One, исключительно приятные впечатления своим колоритом, юмором, музыкой, визуальными данными, и паззлами. 5 из 5.

Особая награда: МЕДАЛЬ "ДУША".

Продолжение следует. И я его искренне жду. Больше, чем громкие блокбастеры игровой индустрии, которые выйдут во второй половине 2015 года.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141666874', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1437015653}
review:
A really good point-and-click game. The story is interesting, the artwork is amazing, with a unique African ("Afro-noir," according to the devs) vibe, and the music is absolutely beautiful. It's part two of three, with three upcoming probably next year. This one picks up right after the cliffhanger ending of the first part and ends with another one, but the story in between does a good job of filling in more backstory and plot without hitting you over the head with a ton of exposition and setting up a couple of twists that lead to the next part. 

The only real con I noticed were consistently inaccurate or misspelled captions. I expect at least one typo for any text-heavy game, but there are more in this one than I've seen in a number of amateur games. Some of the voice recordings are of a noticeably lower quality than the rest, but I only noticed that a few times. 

Overall, very much worth playing if you like this style of adventure game, even with the episodic nature of it.

In this particular case, I would be absolutely okay with paying full price for the soundtrack as a separate purchase, because it is that good. Also, their original composer passed away last year and apparently there's an album of his music up for purchase., from which all the proceeds go to charity. I think it was a nice touch that they featured that as a very muted 'hey, if you like his music, you can get this, too' ad at the end of the behind-the-scenes extra that's unlocked once you finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003919468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 3459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1671537171}
review:
funny mischievous anarchic at times, these games are total face crackers, reminds me of the old lucas arts games before a certain fascist mouse dug its claws in. Enjoy the s*?t out of it!
great voice over, full array of puzzles, good soundtrack, many funny interactions and action interspersed. fun game for all.
Full disclosure, my playtime is not accurate, ill play morning, noon or night and yes, ive slept with this game ........DONT JUDGE ME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968299723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1438502258}
review:
Chapter two of The Journey Down is an absolute joy if you're an adventure game fan. While I thought the first game was a fantastic appetizer, this was a great follow-up with a meatier, more satisfying second course. The music was wonderful, the dialogue and acting are all great and enjoyable throughout. 

Now the worst part is having to wait for chapter three! I'm almost glad I didn't find out about these until now because the wait would've been that much harder if I had been there since day 1.

Absolutely fantastic and should not be missed if you enjoy point and click adventure games. Frankly, this fits right in there with the greats of the genre. 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059960055', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1412861501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042594600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1437654913}
review: Great as first chapter :) Looking for third :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079017859', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1436204112}
review:
...So how long do we have to wait for chapter 3?

I love the original character design in these games. The voice acting is stellar as always, the music and sound are great, and the puzzles are difficult enough to keep your interest without getting frustrating. The story really develops in this chapter and I got sucked in a lot more than I did with chapter 1. The dialogue does go on for a long time sometimes, but it's well written, so relax and enjoy it rather than trying to rush through.

Overall, I recommend the game, though I definitely suggest you play chapter 1 first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022091113', 'num_games_owned': 1441, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1679101806}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993039039', 'num_games_owned': 1963, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1435863089}
review:
Вторая, промежуточная, но на данный момент, последняя часть в трилогии, которая пока что состоит лишь из двух частей...
Мрхпт.... Так. Я вас запутал? 
Ну так вот, The Journey Down, это квест, который планируется выйти в 3х частях, 2 из которых уже готовы. Обзор первой части вы можете прочесть на моей страничке. 
Итак, вторая часть мне понравилась куда больше, нежели первая, а причина тому - наверное простая, чем дальше копаешь, тем глубже закапываешься! То бишь импонирую этой адвенчуре, а посему считаю вторую часть более приключенческой и, как показалось, она несколько длиннее первой. Хотя, если вы тугодумили в первой, то может все и выйдет у вас наебарот. 
Касательно сюжета - появляются некоторые персонажи, а некоторые так и не появляются (я о затейнике всего этого веселья). Знаете, чем-то это все напоминает фильмы Kill Bill, где в первом фильме Билла вообще не показывали. 
И конечно же, квест был бы не таким хорошим, если бы не замечательные ребята, которые смастерили русификатор! 
Так что сожмем кулачки и ждем 3ую часть.
Понимаю, обзор вышел скудным, но кто обзывается, тот сам так и называется %)

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1432054671}
review:
[h1]Short version: 86%[/h1]
The second part of this Rastafari-themed adventure game miniseries is somewhat shorter than the first one, but makes up for it with a more engaging story, interesting locations, and complex puzzles.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
The Journey Down: Chapter Two took almost two years to reach the players, but it was worth it. The overall tone got a significant revamp, giving it an actual feel of adventure and thrills instead of being a puzzle game with a funny cast.

Even though the characters still act the same way (which is a good point, since they made the first chapter so memorable), the plot is a lot thicker around them. You have to explore a new city where everything seems to be crooked and corrupted, and where the mystery of Kanandodo and his discovery run deeper than ever, making the story progress in territories you may have not even suspected…

…when said story actually progresses. Because the game’s difficulty has increased, despite being made for tablet players. There is less crazy adventure game logic involved, but you have to backtrack often, and a lot. And the last puzzle… even point ‘n’ click veterans may hit a brick wall there.
Still, the game is quite short, shorter than the first chapter, with around 2-5 hours of play time. But the content is so strong that this drawback is barely recognisable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094409455', 'num_games_owned': 1576, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1435261386}
review: The sequel TJD1 deserved. Expands upon the first with a longer story, more locations, better puzzles and equally great artwork & music. Loved the atmosphere! Stoked for chapter 3, hoping its as affordable as the first 2 (bundle incoming!?) :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198079501054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1435203718}
review:
More beautiful, exciting and fun than the first. After the first episode I felt like "ok, this is pretty cool... we'll see how it ends". It's obvious to me now that it only gets better and the entire series is gonna be a blast. 

In this second episode there are more locations to explore, characters to meet, beautiful artwork to drool at and feel immersed in... you won't be disappointed. A little genre jewel!

RIP Simon D'Souza, your music was truly a gift.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996124118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1418681943}
review: Shiny, different, unique, wholesome, artistic and I wanted to get into it. I just really couldn't. If I were a new gamer I may have enjoyed it alot more; alas, 30 years of various PC games under my belt I might be a bit too jaded. The makers of this game had heart and style which are an important feature not always found in games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970943378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1434506569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069635016', 'num_games_owned': 2885, 'num_reviews': 808, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1433074031}
review:

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999241918', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1431177732}
review:
The second, even more fabulous part of The Journey Down.

Are you into Noir? Have you played the first game? Grab this one for sure.
If you haven't played the first one, go ahead and try it, read my review on that and find out if it's to your liking or not. I wouldn't say that everyone will like it, some will hate it for some obscure reason (maybe simply for it not being Grim Fandango).

It has all that noir fan would want: misty, dripping wet streets, shaded lighting, the whole backwater town atmosphere, characters... Even a typical crooked cop and a <spoiler here>. It is still a very good adventure game without too much obscure connections to be made, and with a slight tint of humor. A few traditional puzzles (nothing original here) also made their way into the game without disrupting much of the process or making you rack your brains too much.

And I still rank this better than Deponias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038106467', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1700666750}
review: Con il secondo capitolo entriamo nell'oscuro cuore di questo mondo fatto di ombre (letteramlmente), corruzione, decadenza urbana e complotti. Sugli enigmi, siamo più o meno allo stesso livello del primo capitolo: difficili quanto basta. La storia qui inizia a svilupparsi ma lo stretto necessario per creare interesse. Il vero aspetto che conta non è tanto quello della storia, per quanto non manchino rivelazioni e colpi di scena interessanti, quanto le atmosfere noir che qui raggiungono vette altissime come non se ne vedevano dai tempi di Grim Fandango. Direi che certamente il secondo capitolo è superiore al primo, ora tutto sta a vedere cosa accadrà nel terzo. Forse la trilogia non farà il botto, ma certemante è un prodotto particolare che gli avventurieri potranno apprezzare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141468732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1428772371}
review: The Journey Down: Chapter Two continues the story of Bwana and Kito as they search to uncover the mysteries of the Underworld. The game follows the same formula as the first and relies on classic point-n-click gameplay. Much like Chapter One, the game's strengths lie in its witty characters,  clever puzzles and funky soundtrack. The game introduces new locations, characters and takes roughly twice as long to complete than the original. Another fantastic installment in the trilogy,

author: {'steamid': '76561198011388211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1430641870}
review: Ok, so... The Journey Down Chapter 2. Just like the first chapter this game is funny, well written, interesting to explore. Funny dialogues, a very peculiar visual style, The Jouney Down surely deserves a chance. Maybe a little too easy (I just got stuck on one puzzle, the last one) but it kinda helps the story to flow. A nice little game that will keep you interested for 3-4 hours, it's original, the voiceover is great, TJD2 is definitely worth a shot. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030977778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1455940952}
review:
A beautifully made old school point & click game with a new innovative polished look and an amazing story line.
This game series sits at the very top of the adventure games classics like grim fandango, full throttle and monkey island.
The in-game music is magnificent, the characters and their voices unbeliveably likeable. 

It's a 10/10 in my book, great job.
Cant wait for the 3rd chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013128422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1442013160}
review: The 2nd installment was larger then the first one, but a little less humoristic. However, it was very enjoyable for a indie game! I really liked the behind the scenes part after the game was finished. Makes you much more appreciating the work, and really a great insight in the process. Waiting for the 3rd one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1428818204}
review: A definite improvement over Chapter 1, which was just solid. Chapter 2 elevates Journey Down to the higher quality adventure games that have been keep coming out in recent years. This time around the game is up to its neck in noir and the atmosphere is really good. The writing doesn't rival the greats but the cast is likable and it has a fun story. The puzzles are logical though some are a tad bit trial and errory but they're overall good. I never had to consult a guide which is a plus for me. Hopefully Chapter 3 really ends on a high note because the game's been improving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039277645', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1530810814}
review:
A great adventure all around The graphics are gorgeous (if a little janky in places, but come on , it is a small studio) and the story really takes off in this part. The characters are really nicely written, even smaller roles are very nicely realized and relatable. 
The puzzles are somewhat on the easy side, but for once that did not bother me. Just nice smooth sailing throughout, without actually feeling under-challenged. It helps that the results of solving a puzzle are often quite funny.

The voicework is also very good, with a lot of charming accents, that do not feel stereotypical in their rasta vibe because of the obvious love for it.

But what really stands out to me is the awesome soundtrack. The Jazz tunes by Simon d'Souza are really something special and complement the scenes perfectly.  
When I saw that he had died while the game was in development (it is mentioned in the credits and behind the scenes material) I was very saddened. 

If you like adventure games, I wholeheartedly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211629312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1431114778}
review: I really liked the first chapter of TJD but the second chapter was much better.  Excellent graphics, wonderful music, amusing dialogue, great voice acting.  The story was interesting and the puzzles were fairly simple, but satisfying, allowing the story to move along smoothly.  But that last puzzle - all I can say is I'm glad I found a walkthrough or I never would have solved it.  I am very much looking forward to chapter three.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997295102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1437036477}
review:
This is a gem of an adventure game. I played the first chapter and enjoyed it enough to rebuy it here on steam along with fully supporting the release of chapter two. If you enjoy the genre in the slightest then get this. These devs deserve the support. Can't wait for the third chapter!

Atmosphere -
 Monkey Island meets Grim Fandango in a dark, wet and jazzy neon lit world. 

Sound - 
 The voice acting is decent, but entertaining and the soundtrack is a moody masterpiece.

Gameplay - 
 Familiar point and click mechanics with simple, but logical puzzles.

Story - 
 Light, but original with enjoyable characters on par with those that inhabited the early Lucasarts adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025050975', 'num_games_owned': 1627, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1422124231}
review: A short, but funny point-n-click adventure. Not too hard, except for the last puzzle - but I am very bad at connecting visual doodles... Otherwise, I enjoyed the entire journey down (pun intended), with its atmospheric jazz music and unique graphical style. Can't wait for chapter three...

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1420926882}
review: Big improvement on chapter one, which was already great. The game is a bit longer, the puzzles are a bit more logical, and the new town expands the story in weird and wonderful ways. Great music. Highly recommended for adventure fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998329015', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1419040519}
review: What can I say that hasn't already been said? It's a definite improvement over the first chapter that I already enjoyed plenty. The double click fast travel is a welcome addition, the puzzles flow somewhat smoother while still being easy (and I still don't mind) and the art and music is as lovely as ever. What else is there to say? It's as it should be, being a total improvement in every way. Bring on the third and final chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018638906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1413863319}
review:
Awesome... looking forward to number 3
I spent about 4 hours in this world and will definitely replay the series before chapter three drops. 
Amazing game i spent twice as much time in chapter two than chapter one, just some reference for how long it is compared to the first chapter. 
The artwork and the characters are sill super funny. there is a lot of good dialog even more now. 
No matter what you think of this review i would recommend you to buy this game. Even if you have only the smallest interest in point and click adventure, mystery, puzzle games. author: {'steamid': '76561197965376405', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1415774956}
review: I received, free of charge, the first retail chapter of The Journey Down courtesy of series artist and designer, Theodor Waern. My expectations, as such, were well within check. It could have been just another run-of-the-mill adventure game, and I still would have been more or less satisfied. I was pleasantly surprised to find a thoroughly enjoyable retro inspired 2D adventure with a certain golden era of LucasArts charm. Particularly evoking memories of Grim Fandango, Full Throttle and Monkey Island. When I think of The Journey Down, much as I do of those LucasArts classics, I am reminded first and foremost of the gorgeous painted art styles and music. I suspect that great care went into their design. Most of them even still hold up after 20 some years! Storywise, The Journey Down is fairly typical adventure game fair. There is a mysterious book that is said to lead to an underland/underworld, and everyone seems to wish to possess it. You control Bwana, a down on his luck gas station owner (and would-be adventurer), whose father went missing many years before. He, along with his sidekick, Kito, join forces with a young woman named Lina, who happens to be searching for the aforementioned book. That book, by the way, is aptly titled The Journey Down! The series' puzzles vary in difficulty, but most are just right, with the occasional "aha!" moment when you finally solve something that seems so easy in retrospect. Bwana does sometimes give away puzzle solutions, but it is perhaps an unavoidable evil in the dialogue. Not a whole lot else to say other than the obvious. Definitely check out Chapter One and Two. The third and final chapter is in development now... mon!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1415522635}
review:
This is a clever and well executed point and click graphical adventure series. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oGB6YNDEGcs
The quality and finesse are up there with such classics as 'Monkey Island' and 'Grim Fandango'. The characters are lovable.... the puzzles are just right....the story is intriguing and has you hook from the start with it's African theme. To top it all off, the graphics and animations all add additional flavour to the experience. - Superb!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080198365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1415053287}
review:
Great point and click adventure! The voice acting is high quality, the ambience is charming, the characters are funny and the plot engaging. Most of the puzzles are easy, which is good if you are looking for some relaxing casual gaming, but you might not like it if you are an hardcore gamer. Maybe it's slightly short but it's quite cheap as well.
The music is great too, unfortunately I found out that its composer recently died prematurely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062311312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1415226685}
review:
As a person that holds Grim Fandango to be the greatest game of all times i wasnt expecting to come upon a game that actually can give me the same feeling as GF. But thats exactly where The journey down have succeded! 

Its not a hard game, which for me is great since you can focus more on the story and less on clicking all over the screen to try to solve an unlogical puzzle. Superb writing, great soundtrack, great humor and beautiful sceens. This is a purchase you wont regret!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044147828', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1413709964}
review: The Journey Down is a wonderfully afro-infused adventure, with Chapter Two giving it a great noir detective vibe reminiscent of the second chapter of Grim Fandango. The jazzy soundtrack of the late Simon D'Souza has been amazingly carried on by Jamie Salisbury and has been recorded with a full orchestra. The original voice cast is as colourful as before and is joined by newcomers dripping with character. The puzzles offer entertainment and light challenge while the story gives a simple yet endearing motivation throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039456691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1412437932}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007762221', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1412748005}
review:
The Journey Down: Chapter 2 is a *huge leap* from Chapter 1.  
If you have played the first and are nostalgic of classic games such as Monkey Island, I would recommend this for you.  

I smiled, giggled, and quite enjoyed it a lot!  :)
The soundtrack is relaxing and amazing. The characters are just as charismatic as in Chapter 1 and the dialogue / story-line have an even greater sense of humour.  

Additionally, this game's VOICE actors are talented - which makes the game much more immersive.  They did an incredible job for you to relate to the characters even though they are quite simplistic visually; in a sense that their faces are all based on "African" or "Caribbean" wooden face masks but which were carefully chosen by design to portray their basic personality traits.
Needless to say, graphically, it's well-done. A mix of simple and complex imagery. The cut-scenes are breathtaking.  The feel of the art-style is quite fitting with the entire story / mood.
The puzzles increase in difficulty as the game progresses... I got stuck maybe 2-3 times for a while but it was never frustrating -  I persevered until I figured it out.  Very much satisfying! :)

In summary:  Underrated humorous point & click adventure.  I recommend that you play Chapter 1 if interested, as there is a progression to the story (**even though I noticed that they made sure via the dialogues that you would not feel lost if you hadn't played Chapter 1, so maybe not necessary?**).  The length of the game was satisfying as well, considering it took me so long to figure out the last puzzle.  Ya' mon! :)

I'm looking forward to Chapter 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972758166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1411008138}
review:
In the second chapter of The Journey Down you will once again be playing the part of Bwana, sorry to spoil it for those who haven't played the first chapter, but the game picks up with the plane crash. You will get to spend the vast majority of this chapter in Port Artue, a city below the previous city that you played the first chapter in. The biggest difference between this chapter and the previous, though, is the fact that the pace has picked up. There's definitely some urgency, and some large obstacles standing in your way. Remember you are still trying to get to the final destination, but there's going to be people who will do anything to stop you.

Graphically you are still looking at the same type and feel as the first chapter. I did like the locations of the game a bit more than the first chapter. You are in a city where it is perpetually night, but there's definitely different levels of feel and look to this chapter. You are going to see the Club Temba, you are going to see a light house, back alleys, some places you don't even want to be in, but you are going to be in. I felt like this game just looked crisper than the first. I know that sounds weird seeing as this is the same engine that powered the first, but it looked like there was more flexing of the muscles in the engine this time around.

Once again the voice acting seemed to fit the tribal masks that were put to the faces of the characters that you are going to interact with. There's also going to be a bigger cast of characters to interact with, and impressively enough all of them will be voiced. What can I say there's just something about hearing voices put to faces and characters.

The controls once again are going to be point and click. Always be on the look out for an object that just stands out, chances are you are going to need to use it, or take it in order to get through this game.

Alright, so here we are, chapter 2. I really wish I could write it without doing spoilers, but there's just some that are just going to have to be said. First off you are in Port Artue. A city in that lives in a permanent night time, but seems to sparkle all the more for it. You are going to find yourself immediately on a boat that is lost at sea. Now I know its not really hard to figure out that you make it into port, but there you have it. You will then have an immediate obstacle put in your path and you are going to find that your crew of characters from the first chapter are going to be torn apart, and it is through the majority of this chapter that you are going to be trying to get them back together. There's definitely another round of puzzles, and utilization of objects in order to reach your goal. I'm going to be honest, there's going to be some head scratching at a couple of points, but if you trust in your inventory, and you are paying attention to the objects you can pick up, you should always have some sort of solution at hand. 

This was definitely a stronger chapter than the first, and it definitely shows itself as giving you a hell of a lot of story, and action packed into over 3 hours of game play. Now I know that this seems like a small number for some, but you have to realize that this is a chapter, and that, in my opinion, is a good amount to play with in a chapter. Now that being said, you are definitely going to need to play the first chapter to figure out all the characters, and story, but this is definitely a chapter you don't want to miss out on. So with that I have to give this game a 9.3 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155640542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1412728772}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999453334', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1485988133}
review:
This is one of the most enjoyable Pont and click adventrues I have play in a long while. It will take you less than 3 hours on your first playthough and yet it does not feels short or incomplete, even while being an episode of a larger adventure. 
While the Chapter One is full of those irrational game-logic puzzleseverything in Chapter Two feel cohesive. 
This is a Highy recommended title for anyone playing a PnC for the first time.
Finally, th emusic nd afro-noir architecture this game presents is something you simply won't found ANYWHERE else.
♥♥♥♥♥/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197977341163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1412616449}
review:
Gran bel secondo capitolo. L'atmosfera, le musiche, i personaggi (vecchi e nuovi) e le locazioni sono assolutamente pregevoli, degni delle avventure old style dei tempi d'oro ed i riferimenti a vecchie ag (dalle ambientazioni agli enigmi) sono disseminati qua e là, basta essere avventurieri di vecchia data per coglierli. Senza spoilerare, ad un certo punto mi ha ricordato addirittura Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis (uno tra i miei top five) e poi c'è questo costante rimando alle atmosfere di Grim Fandango che non può passare inosservato, pur differenziandosi radicalmente, in primis per la trama. Insomma un capitolo 2 da incorniciare, con maggior varietà di locazioni e situazioni. L'unica nota meno brillante devo dire sono - forse - gli enigmi, la cui difficoltà mi pare sia stata abbassata un po' rispetto al primo capitolo (ultimo enigma a parte, dove ho incontrato non poche difficoltà), ma ciò viene compensato da una durata maggiore (forse tra 40 minuti ed un'ora, è soggettivo) rispetto al capitolo 1. 
Voto finale: 9
L'attesa per il capitolo conclusivo sarà veramente dura, speriamo non sia troppo lunga!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965107231', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1419382621}
review:
Great atmosphere and visuals. Incredibly charming characters with the occasional voice acting that sounds ripped from a local car dealership commercial. One of the best soundtracks out there. The puzzle logic is down to earth, a good mix of logical solutions that require you to give thought about your tools.

The game is definitely inspired by Grim Fandango (certainly not a bad thing), so if that sounds appealing, the Journey Down chapters are a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1412032409}
review: Even better than the first episode, here is a nice, cozy story sure to please any old school adventure fan with it's puzzles that are neither too hard or too easy, it's great voice acting, and it's beautiful soundtrack

author: {'steamid': '76561198004575765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1409265326}
review: Long time since I found a point and click adventure that hooked me in the story and gave me a reason to push through, and not once did I get stuck and lose patience, which is usually the case. author: {'steamid': '76561198038570229', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1411788854}
review: Just as good as the first chapter, if not better. I'm not actually sure if this chapter was longer, or if I just was so entertained, but it's definitely a step up from the first! author: {'steamid': '76561197999120693', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1411596192}
review: It's got a really great art style and a simple one button interface. The soundtrack is great too, mixture of Jazz and big band stuff which goes well with the setting. You could play this game without havng played the first chapter, (a character will recap the story for you if you promt him to) but the first one is just as good, although a lttle shorter. If you know you like point and click games, then buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985466857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1411461915}
review: A short, sweet sequel to the excellent, jazzy first game. Still got me hankering to find out what happens to bwana and the gang! R.I.P. Simon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053392309', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1712229747}
review:
Die erste Episode hatte ich ein Stück weit mit Vorsicht genossen, weil man bei so einem kleinen Projekt nie weiß, ob man das Ende der Geschichte je erleben wird. Doch nun ist der zweite Teil erschienen, und er ist runder und noch besser als der erste.

Rastaman Bwana, sein Adoptivbruder Kito und Forscherin Lina waren im ersten Teil aufgebrochen, um das Geheimnis um das "Underland" zu lüften. Im zweiten Teil geht die Reise hinab weiter, und die drei erfahren ein wenig mehr über die Zusammenhänge ihrer düsteren Welt mit korrupten Polizisten und gierigen Kon­zer­nen.

Journey Down Epsiode 2 ist wieder in einem stimmigen Comicstil ge­halten. Die Grafik wirkt schöner als im ersten Teil. Die Gesichter der Hauptfiguren sind, wie die Entwickler schrei­ben, afrikanischen Totenmasken nachempfunden.

Texte und Sprach­aus­gabe sind in Englisch. Sie sind ziemlich um­gangs­­sprach­­lich ge­hal­ten, daher habe ich mir zum besseren Ver­ständnis zusätzlich den Text einblenden lassen. Die Sprecher haben mir gefallen, ins­be­son­dere Bwana ist mir ans Herz gewachsen. (Bwana selbst würde "awesome!" sagen.) Einige Kinder­krank­heiten von Teil 1, wie un­gleich­mäßige Sprach­auf­nahmen, sind aus­gemerzt. Die Musik ist so gut, dass Spieler gleich gefragt haben, ob sie den Sound­track kaufen können.

Die Rätsel kamen mir vielfältiger vor als in Episode eins. Sie sind nicht schwer, so dass man nachher zwar nicht das Gefühl hat, He­raus­ra­gen­des geleistet zu haben, dafür aber die Geschichte ohne längere Unterbrechungen erleben kann. Sehnsüchtig warte ich nun auf den dritten und letzten Teil und hoffe, dass es nicht wieder eineinhalb Jahre dauern möge... (Es hat dann drei Jahre gebraucht. :D )

author: {'steamid': '76561198055270633', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1409519609}
review:
Video Análisis (Con subtítulos en español e inglés) - http://youtu.be/Grb_oI3qfZo

Con el lanzamiento del segundo capítulo de una de mis aventuras gráficas favoritas, he decidido hacer un video análisis combinando los dos primeros capítulos disponibles. 

The Journey Down es una aventura gráfica creada por Skygoblin, un estudio independiente que es super atento con sus fans, y lanzaron el primer capitulo en enero de 2013. Ahora en agosto de 2014 llega la segunda parte con más acción, más puzzles y descubriendo un poco más su apasionante historia.

Continúa la historia saliendo de la Bahía de Kingsport y siguiendo los pasos del diario estamos en plena ciudad, sin querer desvelar demasiado la trama, decir que ahora está mucho más interesante y la historia se ha vuelto super intrigante y engancha mucho! 

Duración, parecida a la primera parte, entre 3 y 4 horas dependiendo lo que te lleve desvelar los puzzles y misterios. 

Los puzzles se han complicado un poquito, siguen siendo fáciles, pero hay más variedad y en mi opinión más desafiantes para los nuevos jugadores.

Es una pena que pase tan desapercibida, cuando para mi es una de las mejores aventuras gráficas indies que he jugado. Espero que le déis una oportunidad y os adentréis en el mundo de The Journey Down que tiene tanto que ofrecer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045082387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1411008663}
review:
Immersive and smooth, this game presents itself as a one-of-a-kind story adventure. The art and style are original and fantastic, the soundtrack is great, and environment is calm and inviting. 
If I had to put down a negative, it would be a lack of personality to a few of the side characters. The main protagonist stands out as an individual on his own, though.
The game gives you a cultural feel developed from viewing and listening to the environment. I reccomend this game to anyone looking for something calmer, but challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998579251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1412455770}
review: The most imaginative world since Grim Fandango, mixed with beatuful hand drawn scenery and classic point and click mechanics such as those of The Curse of Monkey Island 3, wrapped up in the fantastic atmosphere reminiscent of Discworld Noir. Also, the soundtrack is wonderful. Definitely a recommendation to all adventure game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044490526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1410828025}
review:
Yess... This game is just plain beautiful. It's the tiki bar of adventure games.

It manages to be nostalgic without blatant references, to be zany without being stupid or infuriating, and generally manages to avoid most of the pitfalls of its genre. Most of the time the puzzles flow effortlessly, and you only rarely experience the sort of dissonance between story and puzzles that came to be the killing flaw of the adventure genre.

Overall, this is one of the big new titles, right up next to neo-classics like Wadjet Eye's Resonance, Primordia and Blackwell, or the Telltales Monkey Island revival series. I'm not mentioning Daedalic, because Daedalic should pay these guys to give them lessons in game design and story writing.

Big, big A+. I'm sure it's possible to do better than this, but these days nobody has actually done better. Love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061303612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1410587714}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983843337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1510519521}
review: Excellent graphic adventure, old school with modern graphs, animations and music/sound. The journey down is about the story more than details (yet it has some smiley touchs). Think about a Monkey Island (not that i am comparing) but in a more gloomy, rastafarian/african, way. I plenty enjoy the accurate pluzzes but, as I have said, the story, the noir touch, is what i like the most. Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985754231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1410468001}
review:
Alles ein wenig ungeschliffen aber das Herz hat das Spiel am rechten Fleck.
Point & Click im klassischen Stiel. Tolle Musik, atmospherisches Design und sympathische Charaktere. Das Abenteuer ist leicht albern im positiven Sinne, wie z.B. Monkey Island, Sam & Max, etc. somit sind auch die Rätsel auf meist alberne Weise zu lösen, aber nie zu abgedreht, dass es schon unlösbar wird.
Freue mich auf das finale Kapitel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080081498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1409729404}
review: I really enjoy point and click adventure type games. This one is really fun but fairly easy! The story is great and the characters are fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995192485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1410204028}
review: Awesome game. Great point click adventure goodness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127663483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1410107067}
review: Восхитительная игра, видно что разработчики вложили в неё душу. В отличии от многих квестов в которых не понятно, что надо делать и не понятно куда идти, совершая кучу нелогичных действий, здесь всё подчинено сюжетной линии. Головоломки заставляют задуматься и получить от игры удовольствие, а не отчаянно биться головой об стену в попытке понять какое очередное нелогичное действие надо совершить. Берите не пожалеете !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987098258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1410027390}
review:
If you are a fan of Grim Fandango, this is a LOT better than Broken Age (and I did enjoy broken age).

Originally seeing the trailers for chapter 1 I thought "this looks a bit like grim fandango, but a little rough around the edges" so I wasn't convinced. Since Chapter 2 came out and the first one was on sale I bought it and it is worth it. The storytelling is great, shot-not-tell, and the atmosphere smacks of Fadango, but is certainly a unique tale of its own. Each character has a distinct personality. Imagine if there was only one jazz album ever, anyone who tried to emulate it could be accused of "copying," but suffice to say this is expanding the genre in a fun way and GODDAMNIT THERE SHOULD BE MORE OF THIS.

Soundtrack is also top tier, contributes a great deal of the atmosphere.

Overall the game is pretty simple, you don't get stuck, but if broken age is 1/10 difficulty and the original discworld is 9/10, then this is about 3/10 in terms of difficulty, but really it is more about the dialouge and atmosphere.

If you are looking for a story-driven adventure game and questioning whether this is worth it: It is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970736784', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1435547272}
review: TJD Part 1 was a fun back-to-roots point-and-click, but it was just setting the stage. Part 2 surpasses it in every way. The graphics are wonderful, the story excellent, the characters funny and interesting. And, oh, that completely AWESOME soundtrack! It's hard to believe this is an indie adventure, there are AAA titles that never come close to this level of polish and dedication to detail. Hell, I even love the voice acting. If you're familiar with adventure games, you know this is something that's very hard to get right. If you loved Lucasarts and Sierra adventures, you owe it to yourself to play this amazing game. If you liked the first chapter, you will LOVE chapter 2! Now the wait begins for Chapter 3..,.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979870113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1409603787}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999180831', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1421279661}
